Description: Amazing view Great value Centrally located  Quirky decor  Off street parking  Cannabis friendly Super host operated One Bedroom with full size bed, Approximately 850 square feet, with Bathtub, full kitchen with dishwasher. Quick walk to bus routes, five minutes from downtown, or a six dollar cab ride. What makes this place special is its uncommon aboriginal aesthetic and breathtaking views. The main room has two large windows with views spanning from the Willamette River to the Cascade Mountains. Mount Hood, Mt. Adams and the infamous Mount St. Helens are in clear view. You are on top of our beautiful city. The apartment belongs to world renown Tuvan Throat Singer, Soriah.  The walls are covered in ethnic folk art, costumes and relics from years of international travel and stage performance. This is a sacred space, and may be a bit intense for the casual traveler.  Located on the lower slope of the Portland Heights Neighborhood known as "Gander Ridge" in the Southwest Hills. This is a
House Rules: Smoking permitted outside. One of two bedrooms closed off. Please be respectful of downstairs neighbors. No pets. Please respect the art and relics, do not move or handle.
Interaction: You will have the Shaman Perch to your own. I will be available 24/7 to address any questions or concerns. I also have my co-host neighbor Amanda available for immediate emergencies including lock outs etc.

Description: Great location! Easy access to NW Portland, downtown and the west hills. Very walkable! Great space to relax in comfort when you're done exploring. The studio is located in the lower level of our home, under our living space, and is accessed by an exterior stairway. It features a queen sized bed, private full bath, comfortable seating area, kitchenette and bistro table.  The kitchenette has a mini-fridge, microwave, sink, toaster, and dish ware. Perfect for snacks and light meals. There is also a hair dryer in the bathroom, and an iron and ironing board in the closet. The unit has good light and is very clean. You'll also enjoy a private deck with its own seating area. You can expect to find a comfortable, welcoming space where you can spread out, relax and then explore the nearby amenities at your own pace.  If stairs are an issue, this may not be the best choice. The unit is accessed by two flights of exterior stairs, 20 steps. Come and go as you please without worrying about disturb
House Rules: Smoking tobacco or cannabis anywhere on property is NOT allowed.  Parking passes are required for street parking Monday - Friday for more than 2 hours between 7AM and 6PM, and more than 90 minutes between 6PM and 10PM. On Saturdays and Sundays it is 90 minutes between 1PM and 10PM. If you need parking during your stay please let me know at the time of your reservation so we can make arrangements to get parking permits. Permits are $5 per day and you can pay me directly. The City also requires that you provide me with your license plate number. If you’re renting a car, please send the plate number when you arrive.  By accessing the WiFi you agree to and will abide by Comcast's Acceptable Use Policy. A copy can be found in the unit or it may be viewed on the Comcast website. We are a shoes-off home, there is a shoe mat inside by the door.  Access to the unit is via the gate on the west side of the house and down a set of stairs. Please keep the gate locked. It tends to slam shut so closi
Interaction: Come and go as you please without worrying about disturbing us as you have your own entrance. Enjoy the ability to wander anywhere downtown with ease while being nestled in one of Portland's most historic and charming neighborhoods. I am happy to advise you as much as you want or just let you be. My goal is for you to be comfortable and enjoy your stay.
Name: Goose Hollow Studio
Space: The studio is located in the lower level of our home, under our living space, and is accessed by an exterior stairway. It features a queen sized bed, private full bath, comfortable seating area, kitchenette and bistro table.  The kitchenette has a mini-fridge, microwave, sink, toaster, and dish ware. Perfect for snacks and light meals. There is also a hair dryer in the bathroom, and an iron and ironing board in the closet. The unit has good light and is very clean. You'll also enjoy a private deck with its own seating area.
Summary: Great location! Easy access to NW Portland, downtown and the west hills. Very walkable! Great space to relax in comfort when you're done exploring.
Transit: Both the red and blue line MAX train stops are 2 blocks to the south. It's an easy ride in from the airport, a quick trip downtown or to the Oregon Zoo. If you buy a MAX ticket it is also valid on the bus and streetcar lines. Tickets can be purchased at station kiosks. Please see the House Rules section for details regarding street parking and parking permits.

Description: This is a 1 bedroom with heightened cannonball queen bed, 1 bath, full kitchen (french press, blender, kettle, condiments, hairdryer) dining/living room, equipped with washer, dryer and high-speed wifi... overlooking the Willamette River...  outdoor pool and jacuzzi during the summer... All of this, directly on the footpath which links onto the waterfront boardwalk.  From the comfort of our living room you are able to enjoy both a cityscape, as well as the passing boats and runners on the boardwalk. Since we are located opposite the train station, you will hear the occasional train.. which we like. We are also located just steps from the McCaul waterfront park, which hosts the weekend craft market and a plethora of cultural events throughout the year. If you are attending a concert or sporting event at the Moda Center, just take a 10 minute walk across the Broadway bridge, as we are located right across the river from it! And since you are located in the trendy Pearl district, you can
House Rules: No late night partying This is still our home away for us and our baby, so if possible we ask that you remove your shoes when in the condo and wear them if you are out on the deck. No smoking No illegal drugs No pets All dishes need to be washed and the counter tops cleaned off. Garbage and recyclables need to be placed in depot, right across from parking space. Any disposable items that you have not consumed, please take with you. $25 charge key replacement for lost keys.
Interaction: When possible, we would like to be there to welcome you and exchange keys on your departure... if you have any questions, we would hope that you could call us for any questions you have.
Name: WATERFRONT, NW  DISTRICT CONDO
Space: This is a 1 bedroom with heightened cannonball queen bed, 1 bath, full kitchen (french press, blender, kettle, condiments, hairdryer) dining/living room, equipped with washer, dryer and high-speed wifi... overlooking the Willamette River...  outdoor pool and jacuzzi during the summer... All of this, directly on the footpath which links onto the waterfront boardwalk.  From the comfort of our living room you are able to enjoy both a cityscape, as well as the passing boats and runners on the boardwalk. Since we are located opposite the train station, you will hear the occasional train.. which we like. We are also located just steps from the McCaul waterfront park, which hosts the weekend craft market and a plethora of cultural events throughout the year. If you are attending a concert or sporting event at the Moda Center, just take a 10 minute walk across the Broadway bridge, as we are located right across the river from it! And since you are located in the trendy Pearl district, you can
Transit: Public transit is very convenient, but we are pretty game to walk around, when the weather permits. We have parking if you have a car and there is a bike rental down the road on Naito Parkway. We are willing to provide (some pretty nice) bikes, but an additional security deposit would be required. Please inquire in advance.

Description: Enjoy this modern loft in a historic building in the heart of Portland's desirable Pearl district. Exposed beams, vaulted ceilings, and floor-to-ceiling windows with expansive views of Portland's west hills. Walking distance to fabulous restaurants, galleries, and other amenities. 6 month minimum stay. Gorgeous Pearl Loft for rent in a quiet historic building. Perfect urban getaway for one or two people. Sleeps 1 or 2 in one queen sized bed.   Exposed beams, bamboo floors, contemporary furnishings, fully equipped kitchen, large bathroom with stone floors, floor-to-ceiling windows, library, views of West Hills. Wireless internet. Nest thermostat.   Excellent location: steps away from Streetcar, coffee shops, restaurants, art galleries, yoga, rock gym, fitness centers, shopping, parks. Whole Foods is a 10 minute walk away; Safeway is a few blocks away. Paid street parking right next to the building, or two-hour free parking one block west on NW 16th. But you don't really need a car here!
House Rules: This is a very quiet building, where neighbors are very respectful. Looking for airbnb guests who are equally respectful and considerate. This isn't a great spot for late nights or loud music. Thanks for understanding!

But you don't really need a car here! Enjoy the best the Pearl has to offer on foot from your doorstep, and then return here to relax. 6 month minimum stay. Description: A large, bright bedroom/bathroom suite above a two-car garage that allows guests to park off the street. The unit is across a private courtyard from a townhouse, all part of a  rectangular building with 14 townhouses in a vibrant neighborhood abutting Portland's downtown commercial and cultural districts. Guests come and go through the garage rather than through the owners' townhouse, affording privacy to the guests and the owner. This large, bright, and airy bedroom/bathroom suite sits above a two-car garage, separate and across a courtyard from the main house. With your own access through the garage, it affords you quiet and privacy in the heart of Portland's downtown Pearl District (NW side). The Pearl District has become a destination with art galleries, boutiques, interesting bars, tea and coffee shops, microbreweries, grocery stores, and innumerable restaurants ranging from classic American through Asian to Peruvian: the complete urban experience.  Breakfast or brunch on the week
House Rules: You will have private access through the garage into the courtyard, up a flight of stairs to the suite. Come and go as you please. Out of respect for our town home's neighbors, please refrain from loud noises before 9:00 AM and after 10 PM. Minimum stay of two nights. Use the small refrigerator, coffee, and hot pot in the suite but do not cook there. Our friendly dog and cat are in the separate main house and do not enter the suite. No smoking in the suite, courtyard, or garage.
Interaction: We greet guests when they arrive and typically see them off. Access to the suite through the garage is private so we see them if we're passing through at the same time. Otherwise, we respect the privacy of our guests but we welcome them to visit us in the main house if they see the lights on. We are present during our guest's stay and are accessible by email, text, and phone. We have a glass of wine or a meal together if the guests are interested and available.
Name: Pearl District Private Suite
Space: This large, bright, and airy bedroom/bathroom suite sits above a two-car garage, separate and across a courtyard from the main house. With your own access through the garage, it affords you quiet and privacy in the heart of Portland's downtown Pearl District (NW side). The Pearl District has become a destination with art galleries, boutiques, interesting bars, tea and coffee shops, microbreweries, grocery stores, and innumerable restaurants ranging from classic American through Asian to Peruvian: the complete urban experience.  Breakfast or brunch on the weekend is available, for example, at any of a dozen places nearby. Three city parks are within six to eight short Portland blocks. In our vicinity are a 24 Hour Fitness, an LA Fitness, yoga studios, the Pacific Northwest College of Art, shops, microbreweries, condos and townhouses. The neighborhood consists of rehabbed industrial and commercial buildings along with new construction.      Our courtyard is a lovely location to sip coffe

Description: This one-of-a-kind property sits in the heart of downtown Portland. Built in 1888, this small piece of Portland history has miraculously survived waves of urban development without losing its 19th century charm.  Enjoy a private upstairs apartment. Architecturally, the home boasts original features that make this style of 19th century Victorians such beautiful and intriguing properties.   The steep roofs, high ceilings, intricate exterior paint details, and hard wood floors offer a first-hand glimpse at the handmade quality and timeless craftsmanship of the late 1800’s. The private guest room is situated up the banister stairwell on the second floor and features a new Queen size mattress with a Tempurpedic foam cover, freshly cleaned and high quality linens.  Open the hand-crafted oak armoire to reveal a wide-screen TV with AppleTV or kick back with a book on the chaise. The draperies are light and noise blocking, and there is a white noise machine to block urban noise. The private bat
House Rules: Check in is 2:00 pm and check out is 10:00 a.m.  The guest will be provided with their private entry code to the keyless entry.  This is a non-smoking property.
Interaction: The Airbnb accommodation is currently offered as a “private apartment.” The upstairs is for the use of our guests only.   During business hours, the downstairs may continue to be used as a private (not open to the public) business office between 11:00am – 4:00pm, making the Airbnb portion of the property 100% private to our guests during non-business hours.  The 2nd floor guest bedroom bathroom and kitchenette will be kept 100% private and exclusive to your needs at all times.

Zip car is next door.  Parking lots are available one half block away.

Description: The Historic Hafner Haus is on Portland's registry of Historically Significant Buildings.  Beautiful and luxurious, it is actually the most central single family residence home in downtown Portland! Originally built for Reverend Hafner, the house served as Manse for the historic church next door.  Price listed is suggested nonprofit donation. The Hafner  Haus is a great example of Portland Style Architecture and is very beautiful.  We can accommodate more than 15 people comfortably. There is a extra charge per person for groups exceeding eight individuals.  You might consider renting the adjoining basement apartment if your group is rather large .  Please check out the  separate listing ... "The Hermitage, Hafner Haus, Second Unit". The master bedroom has a King bed , double bed and a lovely deck. The 2nd bedroom a memory foam queen bed.  The 3rd bedroom has a loft style double bed and a memory foam Queen below.  The 4th has 2 twin beds.  We also have a private study which converts to
House Rules: Smoking is allowed outside, in the back of the house. Please limit louder activity to the back of the house rather than the front as well. We recently had that request from one of our elderly neighbors in the retirement complex across the street. I think she was worried that passersby would think that the pastor was doing too much partying. :-) Thanks so much! Please communicate with us regarding extra guest, both overnight guests and day guests as event insurance might be necessary.
Interaction: We may or may not be present at the time of check in...but regardless,  we will be available by phone to answer questions.  If we are not on location at check in, Airbnb will furnish you with the code to the front and back door lock as well as the parking gate lock code. Please let us know ahead of time if you have not received these important self check-in instructions. After check in, please send  a brief  message  so that we know that you  have arrived  safely. We will be available by telephone/email if needs should arise.

Description: This luxuriously appointed 2BR/2BA condo puts you in the heart of Downtown Portland. Enjoy mountain, river, and city views from your private balcony. Secure parking space. Catch the streetcar out the front door to the Pearl, the or walk a few blocks to the riverfront or PSU. 30-day minimum rental. Set within a four-block pedestrian park, the building offers great views of the mountains, the river, and the city's east side and south waterfront with the aerial tram to OHSU. Our unit is furnished for maximum elegance and luxury, with Persian and Turkish carpets, leather living room furniture, exquisitely comfortable beds with luxury linens.  Each bedroom has a closet, two dressers, and under-bed drawers for storage. The master bedroom has an ensuite bathroom with tiled shower; the guest bath has a tub and shower combination.  The condo kitchen is fully equipped for entertaining—granite countertops and stainless steel appliances, including microwave, espresso maker, SodaStream, blender, to
House Rules: Our building allows rentals by the month only, so there is a minimum stay of 30 days. There's no smoking allowed in the unit or on the balcony, and the building has strict no-smoking policies in the public spaces.
Interaction: We will meet you at the condo to give you a full orientation to the building and the unit. After that, we're just a phone call away if you have any questions.

Our unit is furnished for maximum elegance and luxury, with Persian and Turkish carpets, leather living room furniture, exquisitely comfortable beds with luxury linens.  Each bedroom has a closet, two dressers, and under-bed drawers for storage. The master bedroom has an ensuite bathroom with tiled shower; the guest bath has a tub and shower combination.  The condo kitchen is fully equipped for entertaining—granite countertops and stainless steel appliances, including microwave, espresso maker, SodaStream, blender, toaster. An HD TV and Internet access are provided. A cozy electric fireplace warms the living room, and there's forced air heat and air conditioning to keep you comfy at all times.

Transit: Portland public transit is amazing—and you can download an app that will help you route your trip using buses, streetcar, and light rail to take you where you want to go. We have maps and schedules in the condo to make it easy. The great thing about Portland is you can park your car when you arrive and leave it there until you want to take an excursion out of town.

Description: A Hidden Gem in Portland's Downtown area! A newly remodeled historic home with Public transport & light rail  across the street. Everything you could possibly want is within walking distance & everything is provided for your comfort - Just like home! The Downtowner boasts an urban backyard with a deck & a second story balcony looking onto a lush garden & fountain. There are 4 bedrooms. One with a Queen bed on the main level with an en suite bathroom. Upstairs there's a room with a King size bed, another room with a Queen & a third bedroom with adult size Bunkbeds (a twin on the bottom & a full on top). There is a bathroom upstairs too with all your bathroom essentials & a hairdryer. We have a very comfortable couch in the sitting room which converts to a Queen size bed .  There is a laundry room with washer, dryer, sink & Iron. The kitchen is the social gathering place with a large breakfast bar seating 6 people. The table in the dinning room comfortably seats 8 people. No matter which
House Rules: We do not allow smoking of any kind, loud parties/music or pets in the property. We do allow a lot of laughter & sharing of good stories!
Interaction: We always enjoy meeting our guests & hearing about their hometown as well as their experiences of our city. We also appreciate your time spent with family & friends so we're not intruding on you at anytime. Just know we're there if you want us to be!

Transit: The Portland MAX (Light Rail) brings you from the airport all the way to our doorstep. One daily ticket gets you rides on all Portland buses, Light Rail & the street car. If you would prefer a Private Shuttle service to & from the airport I recommend "USA Airport Shuttle"    We no longer have on-site parking. If you are coming with a car, there is plenty of street parking around us (metered between 8:00am-7:00pm) or I can direct you to a reasonably priced long-term/overnight parking garage nearby. We will provide you with some compensation for paid parking. There's an endless choice of  rental car companies. Zipcar, Car2go and ReachNow all rent from an hour to a day!

Description: One to three month stay in the Pearl.  Whether here for work, transitioning, or just enjoying extended visit to Portland you will find no better option than this great space overlooking the entire city.   Stylish furnishings in modern eighth floor condo overlooking Pearl District and downtown Portland.  Elegant and sophisticated yet comfortable and relaxing.  Great space for individual or couple with pull down Murphy bed in living area for guests. You will have access to secured building with concierge, secured garage parking, and secured storage.  Building has full gym with new sauna. Close to everything that Portland has to offer.  Step into the Pearl for great food, cafes, and nightlife.  Leave the car in the secured garage and jump onto the street car to check out the scene on the East Side, shop in NW, or take a look downtown. Transit: Portland is a wonderfully walkable (or bikeable) city!  The condo is a short walk to the southern waterfront, Keller Fountain and Auditorium, PSU, University Place Hotel & Conference Center, and not far from OMSI and OHSU.  Check out the newest pedestrian bridge, Tilikum Crossing, connecting you to the eastbank esplanade. The Pearl and Alphabet districts are reachable in a ~20min walk.  The lightrail stops right in front the building and offers access to the city, while the MAX line is a block away and offers access to the airport. If you do have a car, there is metered street parking and multiple metered lots nearby.

Description: A studio in a beautiful 1927 brick building.  Top floor, east facing windows. 1 block from the MAX stop (Providence Park). In addition to the AirBnB rules, you will need to abide by the condominium association's rules, please inquire for a copy. We rent it only occasionally because it's Ines' work base and she needs to make other arrangements when it is rented.  Hence the higher-than-average price. The 31 day minimum is mandated by the condo association.  You can split the time, though. A small (464 sq ft) studio in a well-maintained 1920's brick building. There are free laundry facilities in the basement. Bicycle use negotiable. I should be available to greet you. We can negotiate weekly cleanings/laundering (I'm happy to do it but understand if you prefer your privacy). It is centrally located near all downtown areas, and you can walk to a hundred wonderful restaurants in 15 minutes. It's one block from the MAX station, six blocks to the streetcar, and two blocks to buses on Burnside
House Rules: The windows aren't child-proof and a fall would kill them-- not a place for wee ones... Non smokers please.   No cats.  Dogs allowed if they don't jump on furniture and don't bark. If you want to bring your dog, please tell us about its personality: barking, chew habits, toileting, is it a furniture dog...  We have a dog and the neighbors have dogs, but this is not a suitable situation for all dogs. Renters agree to abide by the common-sense building's House Rules (quiet hours, etc)

Description: My condo is on a quiet street at the base of Washington Park and a short walk from downtown Portland and the Pearl District. It is just around the corner from 23rd and 21st Avenues where you will find hundreds of some of Portland's best restaurants, bars, cafes and boutiques. The condo is large and roomy but is NOT suitable for parties or loud gatherings. There are hardwood floors and any excessive noise will not be tolerated by my downstairs neighbors. THE NEIGHBORHOOD: The Northwest District of Portland is one of the city's oldest neighborhoods and is known locally for its upscale shopping, dining and people-watching. - Groceries. There are 2 large grocery stores only a few blocks away and a Trader Joes about 6 blocks away. - Washington Park (Rose Garden, Oregon Zoo, Japanese Garden, Children's Museum, and miles of running trails through old-growth forest) is about 5 blocks up the hill. PARKING AND GETTING AROUND: With a "Walk Score" of 95, you won't need a car while staying at my pl
House Rules: Check-in after 3:00pm and check-out at 11:00am. 2 night minimum stay. Non-smoking. Pets not permitted. Maximum occupancy is 6 guests. Registered guests only in apartment. Quiet hours are 10:00pm to 8:00am.  Violation of any of these rules could result in immediate eviction and forfeiture of your deposit.
Interaction: I am available to answer questions throughout your stay.

PARKING AND GETTING AROUND: With a "Walk Score" of 95, you won't need a car while staying at my place. However, if you do have a car, please know that parking is strictly limited, although there are some overnight lots nearby. Lyft/Uber, Tri-Met and MAX, BiketownPDX (bike share) are great options for getting around town.

Enter 750 sq ' of fully equipped urban comfort chic.  Lounge on our bronze leather furniture while watching the 55" smart TV. Description: Tucked away on a quiet street at the base of Washington Park (Oregon Zoo and Rose Gardens), this spacious flat is adjacent to trendy and vibrant NW 23rd and 21st Avenues. It is also within walking distance of downtown and the Pearl District. This condo is on a quiet side street in the upscale Goose Hollow neighborhood. With a Walk Score of 97, it is conveniently located just 2 blocks from trendy 23rd and 21st Avenues, and the Alphabet District and 5 blocks to Washington Park. Downtown, the waterfront and the Pearl District are both within walking distance. The building was designed by famous architect A.E. Doyle and is loaded with classic, old-school charm. This condo was recently renovated with a gourmet kitchen, new bath, new hardwood floors and paint throughout. At 1,800 square feet, it is spacious and has plenty of room for 6 guests. While not completely handicapped accessible, the condo is on the first floor, so perfect for those who don't want to walk up a lot of stairs. Guests w
House Rules: I will provide a list of house rules upon checkin that will also include wifi and other information specific to the space, but here are some important house rules: •  Quiet hours are from 10 pm. to 9 am.  This is an old building with hardwood floors, so noise travels. Please be respectful of my neighbors as they are also my friends.   •  Check-in after 3:00 pm, and checkout is 11:00 am. •  This is a non-smoking unit. •  Sorry, no pets allowed. •  Maximum occupancy is 6 and limited to registered guests.
Interaction: I like to meet my guests to hand off keys, but this is not always possible. If I'm not able to meet you, I will place the keys in a lockbox for you and text you the code the day you arrive.

Description: Welcome! Let my home be your home while you're away. You'll have your own private bedroom and bathroom in a shared unit. NON-SMOKERS ONLY. This is the closest that you can stay to downtown Portland and be on the river. Gay friendly. My condo looks out on the Willamette River, which is only about 100 feet from my back door. The bedroom itself faces the city where you'll be able to see trees and the highest skyscrapers in town. It's a very comfortable king sized bed and the black out curtains will ensure you will sleep well. The shared area of the condo has a nice table for eating and a coffee table in the living room that overlooks the river. When I am home, I spend the majority of my time in my bedroom; you will generally have all the common areas to yourself and it will feel like you have rented the entire place. You'll have access to your own private bedroom and bathroom, as well as a shared kitchen, laundry, eating area, and living room/porch that overlooks the river. Outside the co
House Rules: Please remove shoes when inside.  Put rinsed dishes in the dishwasher. Most people enjoy Portland's world-class restaurants while in town but the fridge, microwave, and oven are at your disposal. They can be used to store and prepare simple meals that are prepackaged, reheated, or just need water. If you plan to use the stove for anything beyond boiling water; or you want to make involved, pungent, or messy meals, please choose another listing. I am not licensed to have more than two Airbnb guests inside my unit. Visitors are not permitted, except for solo travelers who may have one visitor. If you wish to meet visitors onsite, try the Rusty Nail Pizza & Pub, or go for a walk along the river.
Interaction: When I travel, I prefer privacy but I'll respect whatever you wish. Some guests enjoy visiting, and others want to feel like they have the place to themselves. I do my best to quickly sense how much (or little) interaction you want. I work long hours so I tend to not be around the condo very much during the week.

Description: Charming, industrial Pearl District Loft, in a perfect location, in one of Portland's hottest district. You’ll have many options here for bars, restaurants, cafes, shops, parks, boutiques. Portland’s food scene is amazing, and plenty to chose right out your back door. This city is very walkable to all of the Downtown/NW districts. If you don’t feel like walking, the Portland streetcar has a stop just a hop skip across the street to take you downtown, Nob Hill, or venture off to the east side. This cozy loft is about 800sf with a nice open floor plan, with 12’ ceilings. Original timber and ductwork exposed, lends a true industrial loft feel from this old, 1910 built Portland warehouse. The building was converted into loft living spaces in early 2000’s at the beginning of one of the nations largest urban renewal projects now called “The Pearl District”. This is a secured access building. The space includes a full kitchen with everything you need to cook with. TV with Amazon Fire stick to
House Rules: This is a non smoking property, the condo association has a noise ordinance of 9am to 10pm, to keep our neighbors happy. You will have one garage door opener for parking space, two Fob keys to get you in and out of the building and two house keys. Please note:  make sure people use their own fob key to enter the building and never let anyone in otherwise, as with the garage door opening and closing, always wait until it closes behind you, not letting anyone in or out.
Interaction: Upon request.
Name: Industrial Pearl District Loft with FREE PARKING
Space: This cozy loft is about 800sf with a nice open floor plan, with 12’ ceilings. Original timber and ductwork exposed, lends a true industrial loft feel from this old, 1910 built Portland warehouse. The building was converted into loft living spaces in early 2000’s at the beginning of one of the nations largest urban renewal projects now called “The Pearl District”. This is a secured access building. The space includes a full kitchen with everything you need to cook with. TV with Amazon Fire stick to stream your favorite apps (no cable tv). Non smoking property.
Summary: Charming, industrial Pearl District Loft, in a perfect location, in one of Portland's hottest district. You’ll have many options here for bars, restaurants, cafes, shops, parks, boutiques. Portland’s food scene is amazing, and plenty to chose right out your back door. This city is very walkable to all of the Downtown/NW districts. If you don’t feel like walking, the Portland streetcar has a stop just a hop skip across the street to take you downtown, Nob Hill, or venture off to the east side.
Transit: Streetcar, light rail, train station. Right off freeway exit/entrance. Approximately 20 min from PDX airport by car, or 45 min by light rail.

Description: I am offering a unique opportunity to live like a local for a minimum of 1 month. June has recently become available so I’ve lowered the price down to $5000.  Included in the price is secure underground parking. The condo is well stocked so just bring your suitcase and you'll be good to go. I am confident that the condo will exceed your expectations as careful attention to detail has been made.  I have August also available. I’m offering a reduced price of $6000 which is a $1000 discount. Staying in the heart of the vibrant Pearl district offers our guests the unique opportunity to have all of Portland at their command.  Whether you want to wander a few blocks on foot to eat at a Zagat rated restaurant or want to hop on the street car to explore the nation's highest ranked farmers market located on the grounds of Portland State University, the condo provides an excellent location for your visit to Portland. With 3 stunning parks within a few blocks of the condo, you can plan your day t
House Rules: We ask that you are sensitive to your neighbors by keeping noise to a minimum after 9:00 P.M. and before 9:00 A.M.   This is a non-smoking building, which includes the balcony and areas around the building.
Interaction: In an effort to make you as relaxed and comfortable during your stay in the Pearl, we are available to answer questions and provide recommendations for what ever you might need.  Our goal is to provide a quiet and peaceful setting for you to enjoy your time in Portland.
Name: Luxury In The Pearl
Space: Staying in the heart of the vibrant Pearl district offers our guests the unique opportunity to have all of Portland at their command.  Whether you want to wander a few blocks on foot to eat at a Zagat rated restaurant or want to hop on the street car to explore the nation's highest ranked farmers market located on the grounds of Portland State University, the condo provides an excellent location for your visit to Portland. With 3 stunning parks within a few blocks of the condo, you can plan your day to relax or take in everything that Portland has to offer.  There's no need to even rent a car as this city has designed excellent public transportation networks.  In fact, urban planners from around the world come to study the programs and policies that Portland has implemented to optimize quality of life for city dwellers.

Description: Broadway is a bustling street in the heart of Portland. This cozy unit, referred to as the Angel's Rest Suite, in a fourplex is located on the Eastside near the Moda Center, restaurants, etc. Downtown Portland is a 7-minute drive across the bridge. 3 blocks from BIKETOWN rental location! Each one of our vacation units are custom themed and fully furnished with large living room, formal dining room, full size kitchen, large bedrooms and large sun rooms. You won't find a better nightly rental deal in the Central City. There are 2 bedrooms, one with a queen bed, the other with 2 twins (which can be converted to a King upon request.) There are 2 sofa beds, one in the living room, one in the sun room. For large groups, there is also a full sized hidden bed in the dining room. There is a large table in the dining room, so you can cook, share a meal together, and then go out on the town or stay in and watch a movie on one of the 2 Roku TV's with Netflix, Amazon Prime, & Hulu subscriptions. We

Description: Minimum 30 night stay. Enjoy an inner city river front sanctuary in downtown Portland for business, study, or vacation. Streetcar, MAX, train station and Portland's fantastic Riverwalk are steps away. Trains, boats, wildlife, bikes, birds, planes, walkers, runners, swimmers, and ships pass by.  Private parking, full kitchen, washer/dryer, cable, WiFi, river view balcony, hot tub, pool. Extra bed for visitors. No deposit. Convenience store. No pets. Located near Portland’s Pearl District neighborhood and Oldtown-Chinatown. In the shadow of the famous Steel Bridge in the heart of Portland, this interior-designed space comes equipped with fabulous furniture, fresh linens, full kitchen, and beds of high quality.  Steps away from Max light rail, Amtrak Union Station, street car lines,  public transit, and Portland's beautiful river walk. As an AirBnb Super Host, we enjoy providing the true inner city Portland experience to our guests. Host is available in person for guest's needs but we  wi
House Rules: - Enter and exit quietly out of respect for neighbors. Security Gates close at 10:p.m. after which you must enter or exit through security gate. - Parking space number provided after booking. Parking allowed in designated space only.  - Please honor and observe all posted pool and spa rules out of respect for neighbors.
Interaction: Keyless entry. Host  is close by, available 24/7.  We will assist you in any way possible. We will show you around in person if requested. And of course, we respect your privacy.

Description: Welcome to the home base for your car-free Portland weekend. 30 minutes from the airport. 10 minutes from the Amtrak station and the inter-city Bolt Bus to/from Seattle. Walk to most of Portland's attractions. Stop back by during your day for pit stops, showers, naps, or to drop off your sales-tax-free purchases. Enjoy easy access to all of Portland via user-friendly public transportation - choose from any MAX light rail line, streetcar line, and 20 bus lines. No frills, all the basics covered. Inside a small modern 450sf / 42m2 1-bedroom apartment, your room is 10 x 12 feet / 3 x 3.3 meters with a high ceiling and a double/full bed. There is space on the bedroom floor for your suitcases, shelves for personal items, and a bathroom sink top for your toilet articles. Upon request, get a bar and hangers for your clothes. If you're looking for  luxury and total privacy, this is not the place. It's about having a clean, safe, comfortable, affordable and conveniently-located place to sleep a
House Rules: This is a residential building and home to its occupants. Move about quietly in common areas. Be respectful of residents and security guards. Do not loiter or have companions wait in the lobby. Never enter the building while visibly intoxicated or otherwise impaired or disorderly. Unruly guests could close all of us down.
Interaction: Katherine, your warm and friendly host, is frequently at home. She sleeps on the sofa in the living room next to your bedroom - even when she has no guests. When you check in, she'll get you oriented and make recommendations to ensure you enjoy your stay. You'll have a shelf full of guides, maps and brochures to get you started. If you need anything, you can ALWAYS call/text at any time
Name: Portland City Center - In the Middle of It All
Space: Inside a small modern 450sf / 42m2 1-bedroom apartment, your room is 10 x 12 feet / 3 x 3.3 meters with a high ceiling and a double/full bed. There is space on the bedroom floor for your suitcases, shelves for personal items, and a bathroom sink top for your toilet articles. Upon request, get a bar and hangers for your clothes. If you're looking for  luxury and total privacy, this is not the place. It's about having a clean, safe, comfortable, affordable and conveniently-located place to sleep and shower.
Summary: Welcome to the home base for your car-free Portland weekend. 30 minutes from the airport. 10 minutes from the Amtrak station and the inter-city Bolt Bus to/from Seattle. Walk to most of Portland's attractions. Stop back by during your day for pit stops, showers, naps, or to drop off your sales-tax-free purchases. Enjoy easy access to all of Portland via user-friendly public transportation - choose from any MAX light rail line, streetcar line, and 20 bus lines. No frills, all the basics covered.
Transit: This location is especially well-suited for guests without cars or in wheelchairs/scooters. Steps to all of the City Center - Old Town-Chinatown, the Pearl District and Downtown. You will be in a central transport hub.  MAX trains, bus lines, Greyhound, Amtrak, inter-city Bolt buses, car/bike rentals are all within a few blocks. Easy airport transfer 3 blocks away on the Max light rail RED line - Old Town-Chinatown stop. Public transport will take you anywhere and is safe and friendly.

Description: The historic church next door allows for a wide variety of meeting spaces. The most central single family residence in downtown Portland, The Historic Hafner Haus is on the historical registry of historically significant buildings and was built as a Manse for Reverend Gottlieb Hafner and his family over a hundred years ago.  We are a nonprofit organization and the price is a tax deductible suggested donation which enables us to maintain this Manse as well as the Old Stone Church next door. The Hafner Haus can be rented as an entire unit with all nine private rooms, three full baths.  It can also be rented as a five bedroom two bath unit without the adjoining lower apartment, which can also can be rented separately as a three bedroom, full bath unit. Please note that 7 of the private rooms are traditional bedrooms. The additional two rooms are private, but common spaces with comfy futon style beds. Please use only the back of the house for smoking and louder activity. The apartment buil
House Rules: Please keep common spaces ready for the next guest. Especially the kitchen and bathroom. Smoking is allowed only in the back of the house.
Interaction: We are always available and would very much appreciate it if you would send a note when you first check in so that we know you have arrived safely. You will have self check-in information sent to you directly by Airbnb so we may be at the house when you arrive but then again we may not.

Description: Silver Falls is 1 of 4 units located on Broadway in the heart of the East side, right off the streetcar line near the Moda Center, Convention Center, Downtown and all the infamous Foodie joints. Just 3 blocks from BIKETOWN (URL HIDDEN) rental location! Each one of our four vacation rentals are custom themed and fully furnished with large living room, formal dining room, full size kitchen, large bedrooms and large sun rooms. You won't find a better nightly rental deal in the Central City. There are 2 bedrooms, one with a queen bed, the other with 2 twins. There are 2 sofa beds, one in the living room, one in the sun room. For large groups, there is also a full sized hidden bed in the dining room. There is a large table in the dining room, so you can cook, share a meal together, and then go out on the town or stay in and watch a movie on one of the 2 Roku TV's with Netflix, Amazon Prime, & Hulu subscriptions. Description: Amazing Historic Mansion in the King's Hill Historic District at the base of the West Hills. The large bedroom features a seating area and all the comforts of home. Share a slice of Portland's oldest neighborhood while visiting downtown (within 10 blocks), Northwest 23rd (3 blocks), the Oregon Zoo, the Japanese Gardens, International Rose Test Garden, Washington Park, and more. Longer stays are available - please just message me for information. The MacMaster house was designed by Whidden and Lewis, two of Portland's most celebrated architects, in 1895. It is one of the premier examples of Colonial Revival architecture in Portland and is featured in several books. The bedroom features a decorative fireplace with hand-carved mantel, bay windows with seating, and historic architectural detailing.  Guests are provided with down filled pillows, a heated mattress pad, a variety of blanket weights, fine cotton towels and robes, and an iron and ironing board. Coffee and tea are available in t
House Rules: - Quiet hours from 10 - 8 AM - 21+ adults only (sorry)  - No federally illegal drug use in or around the house  - Pots and pans need to be washed after use (they're shared) - please no candles, incense, or other flammable stuff  - Please no scent sprays or perfumes (allergies :)
Interaction: Occasional interactions in shared spaces (kitchen, living room, dining room) with casual interactions more likely occuring if the outdoor areas are used. More interaction if guest would prefer (advice on places to eat, sights to see, etc)
Name: White Canopy Bed at Gorgeous Historic Mansion!
Space: The MacMaster house was designed by Whidden and Lewis, two of Portland's most celebrated architects, in 1895. It is one of the premier examples of Colonial Revival architecture in Portland and is featured in several books. The bedroom features a decorative fireplace with hand-carved mantel, bay windows with seating, and historic architectural detailing.  Guests are provided with down filled pillows, a heated mattress pad, a variety of blanket weights, fine cotton towels and robes, and an iron and ironing board. Coffee and tea are available in the kitchen, along with cooking supplies. The house is located near dozens of fine restaurants and great bars, which we can recommend as well. During the winter, a fire is lit most evenings in the living room.

Longer stays are available - please just message me for information.
Transit: Walking, biking (City bike rentals available nearby), very close to both bus and MAX (light rail) line. Parking is very difficult to find and requires a permit for longer stays.

Description: Full attic apartment for rent includes private entrance, bedroom, kitchen, living room and bathroom. The Victorian house was built in 1900 and third floor attic was recently redone with modern amenities.   A unique where entire city grew up around the house.  It's quiet and clean and a perfect place for a couple (plus one?) to call home during a trip!  We request No Children as the windows are less secure than we would like and want to make sure there are no accidents. The house was built in 1900, so it doesn't get much older on the West Coast!  Dolores has put in some fun eclectic decor for your pleasure! Jill  co-hosts with Dolores for the booking side of things.  Dolores will meet you and greet you unless you receive special instructions from us! You will enter the house from the street.  There is a common entry way you share with Dolores. Garages charge anywhere from $5 per day on weekends to $14 per day during the week. We recommend the garage on the corner of NW Davis and NW 13th St.  ($5/day on weekends)

Description: Spacious 2-bedroom, 2-bath apartment with huge windows in downtown Portland A hop, skip, and jump away from Pioneer Courthouse Square, Director Park and Powell’s City of Books, this centrally located 2-bedroom, 2-bath is smack dab in the middle of Portland’s classy downtown.  Feast your eyes on great views from floor-to-ceiling windows that let in so much lovely light. Large rooms let you spread out and relax in style.  Bring your chef’s hat, your cozy abode sports a fully equipped kitchen, though some of Portland’s finest restaurants are just a stone’s throw away! Unfortunately, when you stay in this apartment you won’t have access to the building amenities. Oh well, there are so many great things in the neighborhood to do that you won’t even miss them. You could go for a jog along the waterfront, chill in Director’s Park or go out for lunch at Elephant’s Delicatessen. The wonderful thing about staying in this apartment is that you will be right in the middle of the Portland action, w
House Rules: 1. You’re living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c’mon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn’t super awesome?  2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We’re super sorry if this is a bummer, but it’s our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren’t super surprised that we still mean it.  3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren’t allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal then give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.   4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren’t, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What’s a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you’re responsible for their actions.   6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilarious, there are occupancy r
Interaction: We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should you need us, we’re here 24/7 with our guest services team and local folks on the ground. And if you don’t need us, we’ll stay out of your way. After all, this is your place in the city.
Name: Luxurious Park Avenue West Downtown Condo
Space: A hop, skip, and jump away from Pioneer Courthouse Square, Director Park and Powell’s City of Books, this centrally located 2-bedroom, 2-bath is smack dab in the middle of Portland’s classy downtown.  Feast your eyes on great views from floor-to-ceiling windows that let in so much lovely light. Large rooms let you spread out and relax in style.  Bring your chef’s hat, your cozy abode sports a fully equipped kitchen, though some of Portland’s finest restaurants are just a stone’s throw away!
Summary: Spacious 2-bedroom, 2-bath apartment with huge windows in downtown Portland
Transit: Portland is a delightfully walkable city, so you’ll spend most of your time here getting around on your own steam. It’s not only great for the environment, it will help you burn off those extra calories from all of the yummy brunches and craft beers. Everything is close by, and walking around the Pearl is lots of fun -- there’s always something interesting to spot.  If you do need a lift, you can always hop on the excellent public transport system or download Lyft or Uber and just press a button to get a ride.  Renting a car won’t be necessary, but you might want to anyway so that you can take awesome road trips to some of the exciting nearby attractions such as Mount Hood, wine country, the Oregon Coast or the Columbia Gorge National Scenic Area.

Description: She's a classic 38’ blue water cruising sailboat.  Warm wood surrounds as the gentle dockside waters charm and relax. She is moored downtown Portland on the public dock in South West Portland.  No car needed.   Everything Portland has to offer at your feet.  The lights at night, the cafes, music venues and art galleries are all right there.  Then retreat to your yacht for sunset and a glass of wine.  Watch the river life go by and let the water soothe your soul. Our kindly ship is moored right downtown.  This strong cruising classic is a floating tiny home wrapped in wood and marine ware.  Cozy for two this warm little space is perfect on wet winter days and awesome on warm summer days dozing in the shade. You can't take her out but you can enjoy life aboard at the dock.  She is locked and the key is onboard (hidden). You can text or call anytime day or night, 24/7. Downtown Portland has many corners and gems of food art and music.  Grab a bike and explore. Description: Located downtown overlooking the lively Riverplace esplanade and marina with lots of restaurants, bars and boutiques nearby.  The first thing you'll notice in this top floor corner unit is the light filling the rooms from the large East-facing windows. Next, you'll be greeted with a 180 degree view of the river where you can see SIX of Portland's famous bridges through the big windows. Tasteful contemporary furnishings make a peaceful, relaxing environment. But it's really all about the view. In the morning, make coffee in the well-equipped kitchen and enjoy it while overlooking the river or go out to one of the 3 cafes that are less than a block away. In the afternoon, sip a glass of wine on the balcony and watch the dragon boats on the river below. Relax in the deep chaise and read a book or just enjoy the view of the bridges and the East Side. In the evening, go to one of the many restaurants, wine bars or pubs that are all within a block or two of your front door. Or just stay in a

Description: The perfect location to visit Portland - close to almost everything and a huge room to boot! The house was built in the late 1800s and is featured on the National Historic Registry. There are extensive historic details and beautiful gardens (although difficult to see in the winter :) We have a large kitchen, living room, and a number of outdoor areas (front porch with seating and outdoor dining table) available to guests. King's Hill is located in the heart of Portland. Close to a number of bus lines, the MAX, and freeways, we are within blocks of just about everything you can ask for - the International Rose Gardens, the Japanese Garden, the Chinese Garden, the Waterfront Park, downtown, Forest Park, and Jeld-Wen (Providence Park) Field. The location make biking, walking, and public transportation ideal! The house is up a number of stairs.
House Rules: - Quiet hours from 10pm - 8am - 21+ only - Sorry, no smoking  - Please no candles, incense or other flammable materials - Please no perfumes or scented items (allergies)

Nice living room space with large couch, a dining nook and walk in closet with ample storage space. Pet friendly. Location is key here with close proximity to NW 23rd, the pearl and just 10 minutes car ride to Beaverton (Nike and Columbia campuses). The space comes with kitchen and bathroom essentials, Ethernet and WiFi. guests will have access to the entire building including laundry room I am available for any questions about the space if needed. Close to shopping, some of the best Portland dining and just a few blocks from the freeway so getting around town is easy. Super accessible to public transportation. One block from the Max stop and in a very walkable area.

Description: Beautiful condo in downtown NW Portland, within a few minutes walk to the heart of the Pearl district and the best restaurants, coffee shops, and bars Portland has to offer!  The condo complex sits on the Willamette River with direct access to the riverfront pathway with endless biking and walking!  Free parking, cable TV/WiFi, swimming pool, and hot tub! Full access to everything in the condo I live approximately 6 miles away. The Pearl District is an area of Portland, Oregon, formerly occupied by warehouses, light industry and railroad classification yards and now noted for its art galleries, upscale businesses and residences. The area has been undergoing significant urban renewal since the mid-1980s when it was reclassified as mixed use from industrial,[3] including the arrival of artists, the removal of a viaduct and construction of the Portland Streetcar. It now mostly consists of high-rise condominiums and warehouse-to-loft conversions. The increase of high-rise condominiums and
Interaction: I live approximately 6 miles away.

I provide fresh linens, a coffee maker and microwave, smart TV, free WIFI, and a comfortable space for you and your group to enjoy. There's a comfortable queen bed and convenient pull-out queen futon. Private entrance and self check in/checkout. The apartment is not childproofed. It is unsafe for children. Description: Welcome to Portland!  This condo is in a historic mid-rise condominium building located in the very desirable and accessible Stadium District/Goose Hollow neighborhood of Portland, OR. When you stay at this condo you are within a 10 minute walk to 135 places to eat, 167 places to shop, and 8 places to get fit.  This condo has a fully equipped kitchen and bathroom. There is NO dedicated parking associated or included with this condo/your stay. True studio, downtown living just one block from the nearest Max station and two blocks from Providence Park. Not interested in the Max? You're only a fifteen minute walk from the waterfront or ten minutes to the Pearl District. This is a first floor, corner unit with lots of natural light and plantation shutters to keep warm or cool depending on the time of year you visit. If you're visiting during the Fall or Winter, there is a heater in the unit and it's automatic on/off. There is no A/C but there is a fan and the cross breezes in the evenings
House Rules: Quiet hours: 10:00 PM - 8:00 AM. No parties welcome here. This unit is intended for 2 guests at a time.  Lockout: If you lock yourself out of the property, I will provide access at no cost the first time only. Additional lockouts will result in $100 fee or you paying for a locksmith.  Kitchen: Be mindful of the mirrored cabinets. Do not slam cabinets closed. If a mirror shatters, you will be asked to pay for the repair.  Bedroom: When opening the murphy bed, be sure to secure the legs of the murphy bed in the fully open position so that when you lay on the bed it does not fall on to the floor. I can show you how simple this is during check-in if you'd like. If the bed legs break, you'll be asked to pay for the repair.  Bathroom: This is not your hair salon, please do not cut or dye your hair here. You will be asked to pay for additional cleaning fees or electrician visits if you use the bathroom like a hair salon. It blows my mind that I have to make this a rule.  If there are any ques
Interaction: I live in greater Portland and work just moments away. This condo used to be my full time home but I've recently moved just outside the city limits. I love that Airbnb brings guests from all over the world for various reasons and I look forward to brief and friendly interactions. I plan to always check you in. If for some reason I can't check you in, my mother or husband act as my co-hosts to help.
Name: Urban Uptown Glam Studio - 30+ day stays welcome
Space: True studio, downtown living just one block from the nearest Max station and two blocks from Providence Park. Not interested in the Max? You're only a fifteen minute walk from the waterfront or ten minutes to the Pearl District. This is a first floor, corner unit with lots of natural light and plantation shutters to keep warm or cool depending on the time of year you visit. If you're visiting during the Fall or Winter, there is a heater in the unit and it's automatic on/off. There is no A/C but there is a fan and the cross breezes in the evenings during the summer.  There is a full kitchen and bathroom (with a bathtub).  There is plenty of closet (walk in) and storage space for your stay. You don't have to worry about your bags and clothes being in the way in this over-sized studio.  In the living space there is plenty of places to sit down after a long day of work or walking. The kitchen offers bar like seating with bar stools while the living room has a queen bed, a couch, and ottoma

Description: Experience authentic Portland in this beautiful, vintage gem. With a walk score of 96, we are in the heart of Portland, walking distance to NW 23rd and 21st, downtown and transit. With a view of Mt. Hood from the living room, our apartment is your doorstep to Portland! Built in 1908, the building is a classic example of a Portland vintage.  Our one-bedroom apartment has 10 foot ceilings and giant wood windows. We look over the downtown skyline, giving a clear view of Mt. Hood. Wood floors, original tile and crown moulding compliment the antique feel. We are pet-friendly and smoke-free.  The apartment is filled with light and is designed for comfort and ease. The kitchen is well-stocked, has a full sized fridge and stove (gas range) and a little breakfast nook with a table. The bedroom is cozy and snug, with a queen bed and books ready to be perused. The full bath is bright and inviting. You will have access to the entire apartment, as well as access to the laundry room, located on the
Interaction: We are available by phone and email at all times and are happy to help with any issues that may arise.

In addition, guests can control everything using Alexa or the apps on provided smart tablet. Lastly, the perimeter of this condo is protected 24/7 with security webcams and alarm security system. Description: This upscale, ground floor condo is perfect for a month or longer stay. But nothing shorter, sorry. It’s right on the river! Watch the birds, wildlife, boats from your deck. Right in the city. Seasonal POOL.  Year round HOT TUB. A bike/jogging path is right outside your door. Easy access to bridges /highways heading to the beautiful area surrounding the city. Designated covered  parking space. Small Dog permitted with approval, $100 no-refund pet fee (fee is added to the $150 cleaning fee). Our large 1 bedroom is on the river but in the city. The living room opens out to a private deck with a view of the river. Sit outside and watch the wildlife and boat traffic on the mighty Willamette River. There’s a jogging /bike path steps from your door, also a barbecue and fire pit outside your unit with free logs and propane. Lovely landscaping. Well stocked kitchen comes with starter supplies. Both the living room and bedroom have high speed internet and a high def tv. Blackout drapes in the b
House Rules: No subletting, use recycle bins, use pool passes while in the pool. Respect neighbors. If a pet is approved there is a nonrefundable pet fee of $100 added to the cleaning fee.
Interaction: I’ve got a manager nearby. C.J. Wilson who lived in the unit for 6 years and knows answers to all questions about the city and the complex. He can solve  any problems you may have . I also have a  house cleaner available and I’m always available by phone or text through airbnb.
Name: Pearl condo on the river
Space: Our large 1 bedroom is on the river but in the city. The living room opens out to a private deck with a view of the river. Sit outside and watch the wildlife and boat traffic on the mighty Willamette River. There’s a jogging /bike path steps from your door, also a barbecue and fire pit outside your unit with free logs and propane. Lovely landscaping. Well stocked kitchen comes with starter supplies. Both the living room and bedroom have high speed internet and a high def tv. Blackout drapes in the bedroom. A really comfortable, king mattress. Large closet. Washer/Dryer. Stocked linen closet. Living room has a new queen sofa bed with memory foam mattress. There's a market on premises and a small bar. Lots of restaurants in the Pearl that deliver to your door. Easy access to metro, buses and trains. You don’t need a car in Portland (98walking score), but you’ve got a designated covered parking spot.

Summary: Spacious 2-bedroom, 2-bath apartment with huge windows in downtown Portland
Transit: Portland is a delightfully walkable city, so you’ll spend most of your time here getting around on your own steam. It’s not only great for the environment, it will help you burn off those extra calories from all of the yummy brunches and craft beers. Everything is close by, and walking around the Pearl is lots of fun -- there’s always something interesting to spot.  If you do need a lift, you can always hop on the excellent public transport system or download Lyft or Uber and just press a button to get a ride.  Renting a car won’t be necessary, but you might want to anyway so that you can take awesome road trips to some of the exciting nearby attractions such as Mount Hood, wine country, the Oregon Coast or the Columbia Gorge National Scenic Area.

Description: You won't find a better location!  Perfectly centered in Portland's trendy Pearl district. Gorgeous large condo with full balcony in the heart of downtown Portland.  Steps to restaurants, nightlife and public transportation.  About 15 minutes to all of the best Portland has to offer. Secure condo building.  Second floor, quiet.  Washer and dryer in unit. Plenty of closet space and hangers.  Covered balcony. Access to private condo including washer and dryer, dish washer and covered balcony. We live and work very close by if you need anything. Heart of the Pearl.  A lively central neighborhood in Portland.  Close to downtown.  Walk to everything. Walk to Whole Foods and Safeway, one block from a Walgreens pharmacy. Walk downtown and to the Portland Saturday market, Powell’s, Old Town, Chinese Garden, NW 23rd.  A block away from the street car. A few blocks  walk to the max, Amtrak station, and bus station. Please message me to discuss parking options.
Interaction: We live and work very close by if you need anything.

Description: Location is the best part of this elegant building in the heart of Portland, walking distance to everything. Three blocks from Max Train, Streetcar & bus system. 20 minute walk to riverfront and NW. Quite nights.  One block from groceries, shopping, restaurants, bars, pubs & gyms.  Next door to Lloyd mall, ice skating & movie theater.  We love everything Portland!  We want to share our special place while we travel for work. Pets & all people welcome. Location in a elegant and quiet building close to everything. You will need nothing but your wardrobe for this well stocked condo. The back patio is a great place to bbq or just hang out. I am available for any questions, recommendations or concerns during your stay The Lloyd District is one of the oldest and most established neighborhoods in Portland.  One block north is an historic neighborhood with large beautiful turn of the century homes and gardens to explore.  Every other direction is city fun, clean streets and everything you woul
Interaction: I am available for any questions, recommendations or concerns during your stay
Name: Furnished/well stocked/everything included
Space: Location in a elegant and quiet building close to everything. You will need nothing but your wardrobe for this well stocked condo.
Summary: Location is the best part of this elegant building in the heart of Portland, walking distance to everything. Next door to Lloyd mall, ice skating & movie theater.  We love everything Portland!  We want to share our special place while we travel for work. Pets & all people welcome.
Transit: You do not need a car in Portland. Walking is easy in this city.  The Max Train, Streetcar and bus system are all located 1-3 blocks from condo. Taxis Uber and Lyft are popular ways to get around along with rental bikes and scooters. Parking is free out front of the condo weekends and 6pm-8am weekdays. The parking fee is $1. per hour.  I recommend downloading the "Parking Kitty" app for easiest way to pay in Portland. There is also free parking options around the nearby blocks and in the neighborhood two blocks away.

Description: Light and bright high rise condo in the heart of downtown. * Conveniently located right in the heart of Cultural District, within walking distance of all major downtown attractions. Grocery store, restaurants, gym, farmer's market, Saturday market, waterfront, PSU campus, Pioneer Place mall - you name it.  * Streetcar stops  right outside the front door, public transportation  is a couple blocks away.  * Free secure  parking spot available in underground garage, free wifi, free access to outdoor pool and Jacuzzi tub in the summertime.   * Fully stocked bathroom and kitchen.    Currently there is one queen bed. Can provide a futon for two more guests in the living room if necessary. Well behaved pets considered with extra fee. Breed restrictions apply. FYI: rentals 31+ days are not subject to the city short-term rental taxes so if your stay is 31 days or more you will not have to pay most of the city occupancy tax.
House Rules: Cats are not allowed due to allergies. Dogs of aggressive breeds are not allowed due to HOA restrictions. Other pets are considered on case by case basis.

Access: There's a kitchen, bathroom, some storage space, free washing machine, paid dryer and secure bike storage you'll have access to.  In the kitchen, you can use everything on the kitchen shelves. This includes dishes, silverware, pots and pans, kitchen appliances & basic cooking items (spices, baking needs, oil, etc.). You need to buy your own food though (Safeway is directly across the street).  There is also coffee on the shelves for you to use. (I usually have tea and half-n-half also).

Description: You'd be sharing this downtown loft (studio) with me and a cat named Julien Mayford (Juju). He's a pretty amazing assistant host and I do my best! It's a sunny corner unit, in the city center. I hope you like my home! You have two sleeping choices: the sofa bed, which comes with a curtained off private "room" I built for guests, or if you are two people, you two will share the queen-sized murphy bed (which is not as private).  There's a fireplace by the sofa bed for the winter. It's pretty cozy.  I made my home into a smart one. It can be voice controlled, does many things automatically, and can even communicate back to you a bit.  I'm a gay man, so this can be a queer/gay/trans friendly space. There's a kitchen, bathroom, some storage space, free washing machine, paid dryer and secure bike storage you'll have access to.  In the kitchen, you can use everything on the kitchen shelves. This includes dishes, silverware, pots and pans, kitchen appliances & basic cooking items (spices, baki
House Rules: - Check-in time is 6-10pm weekdays; (weekend and holiday check-in times can be more flexible). I can do a luggage drop-off for your convenience if you need to arrive early. Checkout time is by 5pm.  - Weekday mornings I rise at 6:00am for work, you don't need to get up, but there will be some disturbance then - Weekday nights, due to early mornings, bedtime/lights out/quiet time is 10ish - If coming back late (you are welcome to), please enter and head to bed quietly (I will do the same) - There is no air conditioner, which means summer nights windows need to be open to cool; there will be some urban noise - There is a cat, he is cute and you can play with him - My place is gay/queer/trans friendly
Interaction: I live here, so I am quite available to answer questions, and love lots of things about the city I'd be happy to share if interested. But you can have the trip you came here for!

Summary: You'd be sharing this downtown loft (studio) with me and a cat named Julien Mayford (Juju). He's a pretty amazing assistant host and I do my best! It's a sunny corner unit, in the city center. I hope you like my home!
Transit: It is an ideal place to see Portland from without a car. The streetcar is right outside, and the Transit Mall with all Portland's light rail and bus lines only a 5ish minute walk away. There's a biketown (bike share) station across the street (I use it daily). The building has secure bike parking also. Downtown Portland, with it's small blocks and narrow streets, is also one of the most walkable city centers I've seen anywhere in the US. And many people are enjoying electric scooter rentals these days. If you are coming by car, there is a (paid) parking lot across the street.

Description: Welcome to our historic loft at The Avenue, a secured 7-story condominium building located in the heart of Portland, Oregon. Our condo feels open (high ceilings, uncluttered), industrial (concrete walls and floors), well-appointed and clean. Open the sliding glass door to our spacious balcony with a view of the inner-courtyard and sky. Walk out the front entrance and choose from the finest coffee shops, restaurants, parks, grocery stores, boutiques, art galleries, fitness studios...steps away! The feel of the space is open with high ceilings, industrial, tastefully decorated but uncluttered and very clean. The kitchen, separated from the main living space by a large concrete wall, is well-equipped for your cooking and serving needs and also has a table for two. Enjoy a Serta iComfort memory foam queen size mattress with new bedding and pillows.  You will have a spacious bathroom equipped with towels and all the essentials like shampoo/conditioner/body wash, an iron, hairdryer, hangers,
House Rules: Noise:  Please be considerate of our neighbors by keeping music and other technology to a reasonable volume level, in particular the bass level which can travel to those nearby.   Security Deposit: Any damage to the property will incur a fine. We do require a $500 Security Deposit upon booking.
Interaction: I truly want you to have a fabulous visit!  I love hosting and my goal is for your stay to exceed your expectations.  I am available for your Airbnb questions, concerns, and needs.  Simply message me and I will get back to you very quickly.  We love The Pearl, Portland, and Oregon in general; it has been our home for 15 years so we love to offer neighborhood recommendations as well as great day trips, hiking or coastal excursions, and any sightseeing recommendations you might be interested in.  There is much to explore and enjoy so ask away!

We have high-speed wireless internet service and a 49-inch Roku Smart LED TV flat-screen with Amazon Prime Video and Netflix available for your entertainment.  An antique secretary's desk and chair are provided for a simple work space which includes a flat screen computer monitor that can be connected to your laptop. The Avenue faces Irving Sreet on a closed pedestrian walkway.   It is a converted

Transit: You will have one designated parking space in the secured garage. With that said, you will be in the heart of the most walk-friendly part of the city.  We rarely drive in the neighborhood because of this.  The streetcar is only a couple blocks away and takes you quickly to another amazing district toward the West Hills, Nob Hill, as well as downtown, and even across the river to the East side.  Biketown, Portland's bike share system, as well as electric scooters, are plentiful throughout the neighborhood if you prefer getting around that way. Enjoy our 2 vintage Raleigh bikes stored on the 2nd level of the garage. There are plenty of opportunities to get to where you need to go without a car, enjoying fresh air, and getting a great feel for the clean and beautiful neighborhood!

Building is equipped with a community room, courtyard and gym.  Unit looks onto the courtyard with a view of a nature park and skyline, reap both the benefit of being quiet with a city feel.  Building is located within walking distance of bars, restaurants and conveniently located on public trans. Owners live in the building and have 3 children (Ages 11, 2 and 1) therefore are readily available should anything come up during your stay.  Additionally, the unit can easily be furnished with a crib w/ bedding, highchair and toys upon request.  We also have a few children's sized bikes and helmets. We live in the building so please reach out if you need anything.  We also work in the neighborhood and can be available during the day for emergencies. Unit has a small outdoor patio with bistro table.  We are within 2 blocks of 3 park

Description: This iconic building is designed by Skylab Architecture in Portland's West End. The West end has become one of the best destinations for dining and entertainment in the city. All within walking distance of most urban zones. The building hosts James Beard award winning Chef's Greg and Gaby's Bistro Agnes and Kask Bar, as well as Heart Coffee, And Gold and Arrow Salon. The walk up studio unit has a secure entry through a landscaped courtyard and features an outdoor patio light filled private space with Queen bed and pull out sofa. Modern fixtures and appliances including washer and dryer. Kitchen set up with essentials for cooking in the unit. Patio, unit, entry courtyard Tasty and Alder, Multnomah Whiskey Library, Crystal Ballroom, Ace hotel, Poler, Blue Star Doughnuts, Powells Books, Bamboo Sushi, Whole Foods, and City Target are all nearby street car and light rail stops within a few blocks. Uber / lyft abound

The queen sized wall bed has a Tempurpedic mattress. An additional queen sized cabinet bed has a memory foam mattress for  overnight quests. Washer and dryer in unit. Parking space in building. WIFI and hi-def smart TV.
Transit: Dedicated parking space in building with garage entry fob. Within a block of the streetcar line and bus lines.

Description: Welcome to the Pearl district, Portland's freshest neighborhood. This central location has many restaurants/bars, shops and art galleries within a few blocks of where you will be staying. This condo gives you a view of the Willamette River to the east and a view of downtown Portland looking south. This rental includes parking in the garage as well as transportation from the PDX airport. Master bedroom allows you to wake up to water view with a master bath and closet attached to the room for privacy. The second bedroom offers  a view of Portland's skyscrapers and has a walk-in closet with the bathroom located just down the hall. Pull-out sofa comfortably sleeps two with extra blankets and pillows provided. I am available 24/7 to answer any questions or help make additional accommodations.  If you need to rent a vehicle during you stay, I have a few affordable options. Multiple parks are within a block walking distance, including a dog park with a river view. Description: Elegant fully furnished one bedroom, one bathroom apartment with 24 hour gym and rooftop lounge in the heart of Pearl District. Great weekend getaway destination. Come experience the unique life style in the Pearl District. My apartment is cleaned and very cozy feeling with lot of great amenities. I offer complementary wine to my guests. Super comfortable king bed and extra sleeping area on the couch in the living room. Enjoy 55" smart TV. Front load washer and dryer in-unit. Feel free to cook in my fully loaded kitchen. Free unlimited internet. There is plenty of space for all your suitcases. Beautiful rooftop lounge with wonderful views of the Mount Hood, Freemont Bridge and Willamette River. Entire apartment, rooftop lounge, BBQ area, fitness center, pool table and espresso lounge. I'm always available to assist you just call or text me via Airbnb App. The Pearl District is surrounded with tea (Tea Bar), coffee shops (Ovation), amazing restaurants like Andina, Isabel, The Hairy Lobs
House Rules: Please respect quiet time and don’t play loud music after 9pm
Interaction: I'm always available to assist you just call or text me via Airbnb App.

Summary: Elegant fully furnished one bedroom, one bathroom apartment with 24 hour gym and rooftop lounge in the heart of Pearl District. Great weekend getaway destination.
Transit: From Airport is about 15-20 min with Uber or Lyft.  Great safe neighborhood to walk near by park, Safeway, restaurants and coffee shops. You can rent a bike at many locations to explore around.  Street parking with meter for 2 hrs in front of the building or 4 hrs on the side street Between 7 pm -8 am free overnight parking on street. Portland's Streetcar and Trimet are couple blocks away from to building. Portland has many beautiful hiking trails. You can try few of my favorite trails are the Silver Falls or Mirror Lake.
