Description: Industrial studio loft in the heart of Portland’s Pearl District! Located in the Streetcar Lofts, this studio is in the heart of shops and restaurants and easily accessible on the streetcar line. Whether relocating or looking for temporary housing, this is an amazing place to enjoy living in downtown Portland. This unit is open, bright and modern with 12” ceilings, concrete floors and a private Juliette balcony. LED lighting throughout, dimmable in main room.  Unit is thoroughly furnished with a Nest thermostat, marble dining table, Italian leather sofas, Design within Reach rug and memory foam bed. Ample storage includes large room-dividing wardrobe with hanging space, drawers and shelving perfect for a shoe collection. Bathroom has double vanity storage and built ins for linens and toiletries. In unit laundry.  The kitchen has new high end SS appliances including a gas stove and a black granite counter, and a garbage disposal. Kitchen is fully stocked with cooking tools and small app
House Rules: Well mannered dogs considered. Sorry, no cats.
Interaction: I live on the east coast, but have family and friends in the neighborhood who will be easily accessible throughout your stay if you need anything.

Description: Great Location Downtown Portland (Westside). Just a few feet away from the beautiful Willamette River (NO River view). One parking spot included BBQ grill on the patio  Pool is open May - Sept.  Hottub is open all year. Great jogging path along the river.  2 road bikes included (one with clip-in pedals and one with regular pedals) Nearby public transportation. This is our full-time home so it is fully stocked with cooking utensils. Food is NOT included One bedroom with a queen-size bed. One bathroom with shower and tub. Small patio with BBQ grill. Full kitchen (Food not included). NO PARTIES OR LARGE GATHERINGS (2 person limit). Pool and hot tub access for up to 2 people. Our security is tight so you will be asked for a pool pass.  Waterfront walking/jogging/biking path.  Marked parking spot nearby unit. We are always available 24 hrs a day by phone and text. On the edge between OldTown/Chinatown and the Pearl District. A 10-minute walk to several parks, restaurants, and stores.  Only
House Rules: We are happy to share our home while you enjoy your stay in Portland Oregon. We live here the majority of the year so we appreciate guests who will care for our belongings as if they were your own.  FOOD IS NOT included in the price. We really do not mind it if you use a little of this or that  - just please remember that food is NOT included in the price.  We have 2 road bikes that can be used. The larger red/white one REQUIRES CLIP IN SHOES (it does NOT have regular pedals). We have provided locks for when you are out and about. Our bikes are our babies so please care for them. Portland is known for bike theft so please don't leave them unattended for long.  We do have a queen size air mattress if needed. We also have a pack and play for a small child if needed. Also toys for a 2-3-year-old.  The pool and hot tub are amazing but our property management is very strict. We are only allowed 6 people at most from our unit. Please be respectful and enjoy the sunny weather.
Interaction: We are always available 24 hrs a day by phone and text.

Description: Our private second floor studio space nests on the middle floor in one of Portland's oldest historic buildings, built in 1880. Portland decorative style and designed to be spacious and cozy.  Welcome to the center of our city. Two blocks from PSU, and just 1/2 block from the bus and MAX lines + Portland Street car. Directly above Phat Cart Cafe on main level and very popular Food Cart Pod right across the street. Just 4 blocks walk to the waterfront, and very easy on/off access to the highway. Entire studio space with private kitchen shower bath and laundry are yours to use.  Relax on the side deck and front patio, but please note that these areas are shared with the restaurant below. Interaction: Check-in is automatic - we are always available if you need anything. Message us through app or phone us direct.

Access: Upon arrival, you will call me from the call box and I will "buzz" you in from the street. Use the elevator to go tot he first floor. There is a lockbox on the door to my unit. Description: Clean, comfortable, and simple. 730 sq foot one bedroom condo with all linens, kitchen tools, etc. IN UNIT LAUNDRY 1 true bedroom with queen bed 1 full bathroom Very good closet space. NO NEED FOR A CAR Walk Score 100! Easy access to bus, streetcar and MAX lines! For downtown living, this condo is quiet.  It is in a small (under 20 unit) complex on the first (not ground level) floor. (Ground level in a restaurant) The very large patio, and park immediately across Park Ave is nice with a pet.  See everyone else walking from far and wide to bring their pet to where you already are! There are no public spaces (gym or otherwise). Our building takes up 1/8 of the block. Another 1/8 is an office building on our north side. The remaining 3/4 of the block is the Hampton Inn and Suites. Please note, my condo is on the hotel side of the complex. There is no view of the park from the condo.  Parking is available at the Hampton for $300/month with full in/out privileges. Upon arrival, you will cal
House Rules: NOT ALL PETS ARE ALLOWED.  MOST SERVICE ANIMALS CAN BE ACCOMMODATED - NOT ALL due to family health considerations. Contact me prior to booking if you are traveling with an animal. The entire complex is non-smoking, including patio area! VERY large patio area (over 250 square feet) is shared with owner of adjacent condo.
Interaction: I am (or another family member is) available in the event of a sudden repair or the like. Otherwise our interaction with be entirely via email, text, or phone.
Name: Peaceful Park Abode
Space: For downtown living, this condo is quiet.  It is in a small (under 20 unit) complex on the first (not ground level) floor. Parking is available at the Hampton for $300/month with full in/out privileges.
Summary: Clean, comfortable, and simple. 730 sq foot one bedroom condo with all linens, kitchen tools, etc. IN UNIT LAUNDRY 1 true bedroom with queen bed 1 full bathroom Very good closet space. NO NEED FOR A CAR Walk Score 100! Easy access to bus, streetcar and MAX lines!

I cannot keep up with which brands are most prominent at the time of your stay - so pack your helmet learn while you are here!

Description: I can accept a 1-night stay for a weekend night if the date is within 14 days. Otherwise, Friday or Saturday nights are a mandatory 2-night minimum stay meaning: Thursday/Friday, Friday/Saturday, or Saturday/Sunday. One Bedroom: King or queen in master bedroom, queen sleeper sofa in living area.  Partial kitchen with 2-burner stove-top and no oven.  Maximum occupancy 4. **Please read all details below** The Resort maintains a high standard through its maintenance, upgrade, and refurbishment program. As a result the unit characteristics may change from time to time and vary.      When you check into the resort, the front desk will require a $100 security deposit hold against a credit/debit card in case any major damage should occur. The security deposit will be released back to you on the day of departure. ABSOLUTELY NO PETS ALLOWED!  If you have a service animal, you must let us know in writing prior to booking. PARKING: Valet parking is available for $49 per night (subject to change)

Description: This Portland property is located walking distances to almost everything the downtown area has to offer.  With this property being newly built in 2018 you get all the modern touches with just a short walk away from the historical areas of downtown.  The property is located right across the street from Battleship Oregon Memorial Marine Park which is right on the riverbanks of the Willamette River so a nice walk in the park is just steps away from you. This modern studio unit is a perfect spot for two guest visiting the city.  The queen murphy bed that can fold up during the day allows you to enjoy the living space to relax in between city adventures and with the mini kitchen prepping meals is super easy.  This property also has an outdoor common space where you can sit next to a warm fire or grill up some tasty food if you're not in the mood to go out for dinner. During your stay you are allowed to access anything in the unit and around the property so feel free to explore. We manage th
House Rules: Must be at least 21 years old to check in
Interaction: We manage this property off site so we unfortunately will not have the pleasure of meeting in person but feel free to message or call us if you need anything.  Also the front desk staff is available 24hrs so if anything is needed during your stay feel free to give them a call and they'll be able to assist you.

Description: Located in historic Goose Hollow, you will be a block from the iconic Goose Hollow Inn, and the Goose Hollow Max stop (one stop from the Oregon Zoo, and three stops to downtown). You can walk to Providence Park (home of the Timbers), NW 23rd shopping district, and Washington Park, home of the International Rose Test Garden and Japanese Garden. A gas fireplace keeps the living room comfortable and cozy. The den off the living room closes off to create the second bedroom. I will meet you to give you a key and show you around - I can be reached by cell during your stay Goose Hollow - between downtown and Washington Park, great location. Close to a convenience store and Starbucks. Half block from Max Goose Hollow station
House Rules: quiet hours from 10 pm - 10 am

Description: Built in 1906 and listed on the National Register of Historic Places, the building was originally the North Bank Railway station. Centrally located in the middle of the vibrant Pearl District and around the corner to galleries, cafés and boutiques (Walk Score of 98!) and within walking distance of downtown. Newly remodeled with all new contemporary furnishings and original artwork in a classic context. Two bedrooms and 2 ½ baths, garage, 2,584 square feet – sleeps 6 comfortably. The first thing you will notice is the spacious and airy feeling on the main floor from the 14-foot ceilings. The living area has a linear fireplace and electric shades. The dining area can seat up to 10 people or you can have a quick bite at the breakfast bar next to the kitchen. The large chef’s kitchen is equipped with a Thermador gas range, Sub Zero refrigerator, a full set of pots and pans, herbs and spices, kitchen gadgets and a service for 12 people. The second floor has two bedrooms, a media room, and a
House Rules: The house rules are simple: no smoking, no pets and don't disturb the neighbors. Lease required for stays greater than 30 days per City of Portland rules.
Name: NEW - Big contemporary in a historic train station
Space: The first thing you will notice is the spacious and airy feeling on the main floor from the 14-foot ceilings. The living area has a linear fireplace and electric shades. The dining area can seat up to 10 people or you can have a quick bite at the breakfast bar next to the kitchen. The large chef’s kitchen is equipped with a Thermador gas range, Sub Zero refrigerator, a full set of pots and pans, herbs and spices, kitchen gadgets and a service for 12 people. The second floor has two bedrooms, a media room, and a mini-kitchen / laundry room. The master suite has a king size bed, luxury linens, large master bath and walk-in closet. The guest suite has a queen size bed with its own en-suite bathroom and shower. The upstairs media room has a large  TV. The laundry room with full-sized washer and dryer is also configured as a mini-kitchen so you can make coffee in the morning without having to go downstairs. The mezzanine, with its own private balcony, is set up as an office with a pull-down
Summary: Built in 1906 and listed on the National Register of Historic Places, the building was originally the North Bank Railway station. Centrally located in the middle of the vibrant Pearl District and around the corner to galleries, cafés and boutiques (Walk Score of 98!) and within walking distance of downtown. Newly remodeled with all new contemporary furnishings and original artwork in a classic context. Two bedrooms and 2 ½ baths, garage, 2,584 square feet – sleeps 6 comfortably.
Transit: Portland is a very walkable city and has an excellent public transportation system. If you want to try it out, we suggest that you consult the interactive trip planner on the Portland Trimet website: (Website hidden by Airbnb)  There is a Southbound streetcar stop one block away at NW 11th & Johnson - it will take you downtown. The Northbound stop is at NW 10th & Johnson - it will take you to the NW 23rd Ave. shopping area. The closest MAX stop is the Oldtown/Chinatown stop at NW 1st & Davis (about 16 blocks / 0.7 mi.). Want to rent a bike? The orange Biketown bikes are parked around the city and the closest rack of them is just a few steps away at NW 11th & Johnson - see (Website hidden by Airbnb) for details about how to rent them. If you want your own bike for longer, Portland Bike Tours & Rentals is at NW 2nd & Couch (open 7 days until 6pm). Parking can be a challenge and much of the parking in downtown and the more popular neighborhoods is paid. Parking Enforcement checks frequent

So , just in case - Please keep the common areas , especially the kitchen and bathroom ready for the next guests use. If you have booked a room and were not clear about this detail , feel free to communicate. we will try to work something out for you.

Common areas and bathroom are shared. Your room is on the upper level of one of Portland historic homes. It is a large Portland style house in the very center of the city. It's just possible that you might have the entire house to yourself!  In this case, the common  areas as well as the bathroom would be private. Your entrance would also be private. Description: Named for the beautiful sentinels along the roofline, the Sentinel luxury boutique hotel gives you an intimate room experience during your time in Downtown Portland. Your room charge will be paid prior to your arrival. Nightly Facilities Fee of $24+tax will be collected at check-in. The rooms in the Sentinel were recently renovated, all while preserving the original early 1900s grandeur. Each of our rooms is uniquely designed to appeal to a wide range of visitors. Our signature amenities come pre-stocked in your room. The rooms also have a seating area for the premier-level accommodations. Sentinel is located in the heart of Downtown Portland, in the city’s West End. It’s a popular area near boutique and independent shops, bars, restaurants, and live music venues. Spend the day at the Oregon Coast or explore the surrounding wine country. Each room includes: Complimentary WiFi Provenance Signatures In-room Safe

Description: The quintessential downtown Portland experience.  Bright and airy studio located in the Pearl District.  Expansive ceilings, floor to ceiling windows, juliet balcony, soothing view of the park-like courtyard.  Walk out the building to Portland's great sidewalk culture. Including top dining, shopping, art galleries. Conveniently located on the streetcar line.  Full kitchen with upgraded stainless steel appliances, washer and dryer, WIFI, Air Conditioning, and a Parking Spot! Great space for one or two people, with great amenities.  This condo is located in the nationally recognized Streetcar Lofts, receiving awards for its industrial architecture and interior features.   Amenities include:  -Access to gym -One parking space (included in the rate) -Park-like courtyard -Full-size washer and dryer  -Full-size refrigerator -Stainless steel appliances -AC  -Coffee maker and all the basic kitchen tools -Elevator -Floor to Ceiling Windows  -Juliet Balcony -Iron and Ironing Board -Hairdryer We
House Rules: Quiet time from 10PM - 7AM The unit and property are tobacco free, will have to take a stroll around the block to smoke
Interaction: We rent the our space out when we are not using it.  We have a local property manager who can answer questions and help should anything go awry.
Name: Streetcar Lofts Condo - View, Parking, AC!
Space: Great space for one or two people, with great amenities.  This condo is located in the nationally recognized Streetcar Lofts, receiving awards for its industrial architecture and interior features.   Amenities include:  -Access to gym -One parking space (included in the rate) -Park-like courtyard -Full-size washer and dryer  -Full-size refrigerator -Stainless steel appliances -AC  -Coffee maker and all the basic kitchen tools -Elevator -Floor to Ceiling Windows  -Juliet Balcony -Iron and Ironing Board -Hairdryer
Summary: The quintessential downtown Portland experience.  Bright and airy studio located in the Pearl District.  Expansive ceilings, floor to ceiling windows, juliet balcony, soothing view of the park-like courtyard.  Walk out the building to Portland's great sidewalk culture. Including top dining, shopping, art galleries. Conveniently located on the streetcar line.  Full kitchen with upgraded stainless steel appliances, washer and dryer, WIFI, Air Conditioning, and a Parking Spot!
Transit: On the streetcar line and walking distance from the train station.  Portland also has car ride options like Uber & Lyft, Bikeshare programs (BIKETOWN), and scooter share programs.  (Super fun!)

Description: For an experience of the Portland heritage and culture, a stay at the Heathman Hotel will grant you access to it all. The updated rooms and services provide guests a comfortable stay in downtown Portland. Your room charge and taxes will be paid prior to your arrival. The nightly Guest Amenities Fee ($29.97) will be charged upon arrival. The Heathman Hotel has a variety of deluxe rooms and suites. Each room is stocked with Provenance Signature amenities in the marble bathroom. Guests have access to a personal concierge service during their entire stay. The Downtown location of the Heathman Hotel is ideal for easily getting around the city. Description: Urban travelers get to experience Portland in a new way with Hotel Lucia. The historic hotel provides guests with modern comforts in the heart of Downtown Portland. Your room charge and taxes will be paid prior to your arrival. The nightly Guest Amenities Fee ($27.67) will be charged upon arrival. Guests will discover luxury and comfort in all of our rooms. The intimate room setting is complimented by chic design and curated photography. The bright rooms light up with natural light and bold color accents for a stylish interior. Each of our rooms includes Provenance Signature amenities and our bathrooms are stocked with Lather bath amenities. Hotel Lucia is located in the heart of Downtown Portland. There are many nearby taprooms and pubs for great drinks or check out some of the retail boutiques and restaurants. Each room includes: Complimentary WiFi In-room safe Flat screen TV Locally influenced honor bar
House Rules: Your room charge will be paid prior to your arrival. The remaining balance of taxes and facility fee ($25) will be charged upon arrival.

Description: Lively and stylish, the Hoxton Portland is housed inside an iconic gem in historic Old Town Chinatown. Three dining/drinking options spoil you for choice. Visit the rooftop taqueria inspired by Mexico’s street food, or the ground floor seasonal Mexican restaurant.  Your room charge will be paid prior to your arrival. The remaining balance of taxes (13.3% Oregon State Lodging Tax, 2% Portland Tourism Tax) will be charged upon arrival. A refundable security deposit of $XX will also be collected. Shared spaces reflect the Hoxton’s signature warm, eclectic style and mid-century flair. The vibrant lobby stars rugged beams and exposed brick, a classic long bar and comfy social seating areas galore. Rooms are paneled in dark walnut with artwork curated by Upfor, ceramics by Clay Factor and bookshelves stocked by Hox Friends. Rooms are cleverly categorized by telegraphic descriptors like Shoebox, Snug, Cosy and Roomy. Your room will include: Free WiFi Flat-screen TV Free calls anywhere in the
House Rules: Your room charge will be paid prior to your arrival. The remaining balance of taxes (13.3% Oregon State Lodging Tax, 2% Portland Tourism Tax) will be charged upon arrival. A refundable security deposit of $XX will also be collected.
Name: The Hoxton Portland, Cosy Room
Space: Shared spaces reflect the Hoxton’s signature warm, eclectic style and mid-century flair. The vibrant lobby stars rugged beams and exposed brick, a classic long bar and comfy social seating areas galore. Rooms are paneled in dark walnut with artwork curated by Upfor, ceramics by Clay Factor and bookshelves stocked by Hox Friends. Rooms are cleverly categorized by telegraphic descriptors like Shoebox, Snug, Cosy and Roomy. Your room will include: Free WiFi Flat-screen TV Free calls anywhere in the world Healthy breakfast bag ‘Super Useful’ Hoxton Survival Guide Ceramics by Clay Factor Selection of books Artwork curated by Upfor The space offers: La Neta all-day Mexican restaurant Tope rooftop taqueria with mezcal cocktails Basement bar with American-Chinese late-night eats Hox Shop (with rip-off free prices)

Description: Come stay in our beautiful bright, sunny space walking distance to everything! Our tropical inspired pad is the perfect place to land for urban explorers. ***Please note due to common confusion, the restroom, living room, and kitchen are SHARED SPACE with your hosts.  We keep everything spotless, tidy, quiet for your comfort.*** We love meeting our guests and telling them more about the city!  We give you your privacy but also love to chat or have a drink if that sounds fun. The space is in the the center of the historic Old Town Historic District with plenty of coffee shops, restaurants, bars and nightlife.  Walk 10 mintues in any direction an you could find yourself in the Pearl brewery district, food truck parks, PSU and museum area, dozens of concert venues, and world-class shopping. The MAX light rail is right on the corner, getting to and from the Airport and other parts of the city couldn't be easier. Parking is not hard to find in the area but you will have to pay for it.
Interaction: We love meeting our guests and telling them more about the city!  We give you your privacy but also love to chat or have a drink if that sounds fun.

Description: The illuminating lights of the Hotel Rose neon sign lets you know that you’ve arrived at one of Portland’s premier hotels. Hotel Rose is a place with funky style and colorful interior design. We live by the motto of “Keep Portland Weird” and will give you a modern accommodation and setting to do the same. Your room charge and taxes (15.3%) will be paid prior to your arrival. The amenity fee with Tax ($23.06 per day) will be charged upon arrival. Sleek and stylish rooms give you modern living in the heart of Portland. Our rooms are arranged in a contemporary style with features including soft beds and plush linens, stylish bathrooms with complimentary toiletries, and a work desk in case you need to get things done. The large windows allow in lots of natural light and provide views of the waterfront or cityscapes. Hotel Rose is located in Downtown Portland, directly across from the Tom McCall Waterfront Park. You can easy reach the nearby attractions including the Portland Art Museum and

Description: Lively and stylish, the Hoxton Portland is housed inside an iconic gem in historic Old Town Chinatown. Three dining/drinking options spoil you for choice. Visit the rooftop taqueria inspired by Mexico’s street food, or the ground floor seasonal Mexican restaurant. Your room charge will be paid prior to your arrival. The remaining balance of taxes (13.3% Oregon State Lodging Tax, 2% Portland Tourism Tax) will be charged upon arrival. A refundable security deposit of $XX will also be collected. Shared spaces reflect the Hoxton’s signature warm, eclectic style and mid-century flair. The vibrant lobby stars rugged beams and exposed brick, a classic long bar and comfy social seating areas galore. Rooms are paneled in dark walnut with artwork curated by Upfor, ceramics by Clay Factor and bookshelves stocked by Hox Friends. Rooms are cleverly categorized by telegraphic descriptors like Shoebox, Snug, Cosy and Roomy. Your room will include: Free WiFi Flat-screen TV Free calls anywhere in the w
House Rules: Your room charge will be paid prior to your arrival. The remaining balance of taxes (13.3% Oregon State Lodging Tax, 2% Portland Tourism Tax) will be charged upon arrival. A refundable security deposit of $XX will also be collected.
Name: The Hoxton Portland, Roomy 2 Queen Beds
Space: Shared spaces reflect the Hoxton’s signature warm, eclectic style and mid-century flair. The vibrant lobby stars rugged beams and exposed brick, a classic long bar and comfy social seating areas galore. Rooms are paneled in dark walnut with artwork curated by Upfor, ceramics by Clay Factor and bookshelves stocked by Hox Friends. Rooms are cleverly categorized by telegraphic descriptors like Shoebox, Snug, Cosy and Roomy. Your room will include: Free WiFi Flat-screen TV Free calls anywhere in the world Healthy breakfast bag ‘Super Useful’ Hoxton Survival Guide Ceramics by Clay Factor Selection of books Artwork curated by Upfor The space offers: La Neta all-day Mexican restaurant Tope rooftop taqueria with mezcal cocktails Basement bar with American-Chinese late-night eats Hox Shop (with rip-off free prices)

Description: This room is inside a 3 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment and is bigger than the king rooms at the Nines hotel as well as hotel sentinel which are our only two 5 star hotels in Portland!! This place may not be suitable for everyone, seniors or older guest may not like the location.  Close to all the nightlife and business.  This place is for travelers who want to be close to everything and not have to make a fuss to commute anywhere!! King memory foam Bed Extremely cozy and relaxing Master Bedroom Great privacy compared to most private room listing There is art and nice plant for decor  Mattress is 12” memory foam.   You literally sink into the bed Kitchen is microwave and refrigerator only.  Stove meal prep on stovetop is allowed. Thank you NW 13th. The heart and strip of the pearl district (which looks like an emerald city) NW 23 is great for the ladies who like to shop and find exclusive clothing made by shop owners.  Also just another great street to explore Portland State University  T

Description: This apartment is located in the Heart of The Downtown Portland park blocks.  At this location, public transportation (Portland street car, max train) is all within a short 2 minute walk from the apartment, and is a very convenient way to travel around the city, as well as other surrounding cities. Some other popular things in the area include: Portland’s famous food carts, the Portland Art museum, , Providence Park (home of Thorns, and Timbers), and the Japanese Rose Garden.

Popular restaurants like Morton’s Steak, Mcmenamins Pub are only within a blocks away.  Easy to get around town by hopping on Trimet Max Train or Bus, streetcar Train on each side of the building.  Next door to Portland State University Campus. Magical 360 degree views from the roof top Lounge. You will be in center of all the action with shopping places, Safeway Grocery, movie theaters, and Fun Bars with 1 block of the complex. Roof top Lounge for great views of the city and Laundromats are in the apartment. I’m available on phone, text, or emails. I love that next door is Safeway Grocery store.  Pubs, restaurants, parks next door, and Art museum exhibits is 2 blocks away. Plays and popular shows in Kelley auditorium and Arlene Shnitzer Hall are a few blocks away. Description: This modern, luxury building spared no expense in providing top of the line amenities.  Features include quartz counters, cherry cabinets, gas cooktops, stainless appliances and hardwood floors throughout the unit. Washer and dryer included. Air-conditioning and heating.  Two high speed elevators provide convenient access to Streetcar line connecting downtown Portland, Pearl District, & NW 23rd Avenue. You will feel at one with the city!

Description: Gorgeous Studio Unit in the heart of Portland - Downtown. Professionally managed and cleaned with stylish kitchen, free high-speed wifi and 24/7 support. Fully stocked with all the convenience you would expect at a hotel. We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need 10 AM through Midnight, 7 days a week by SMS text messaging, email or phone Modern apartments in the middle of Portland's Cultural District. Whether for business or leisure this city has a lot to offer. Just a few blocks away from Portland State University, the Portland Japanese Garden and Oregon Zoo. Exploring this city can be done using the Max line or the Portland Streetcar. Our units are sophisticated, have a unique character and eclectic designs. Our roof deck and huge windows provide a great view of the place. Enjoy the co-working spaces in the building. All units are furnished with stainless steel appliances, in-unit washer and dryer, and free fast wifi service, kitchenware/cookware and bathroom a

Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you  - QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. Description: Three queen beds with high quality Serta mattresses in a modern luxury two bedroom apartment. Toiletries, 50" TV, towels, street parking available. My apartment is nestled away a quite neighborhood in the heart of the Pearl District and five blocks from NW 23rd (WalkScore® of 98). You do not need a rental car when you come and visit our home. If you cannot walk to where you are going, chances are the street car can take you there. ✓ Fully furnished and equipped two bedrooms, living room, and kitchen  ✓ Fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided  ✓ Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive, and once a week for long stays ✓ In-suite laundry  ✓ Fully-equipped kitchen  ✓ Walk score of 98  ✓ Blocks away from Safeway and Whole Foods  ✓ Plenty of street parking I’m available 24/7 through Airbnb’s message thread. ***Within 10 blocks***  -Countless delicious restaurants  -Starbucks / local coffee shops  -Oprah's favorite ice cream shop: Salt & Straw  -Portland street car  -A variety of bars

Description: I can accept a 1-night stay for a weekend night if the date is within 14 days. Otherwise, Friday or Saturday nights are a mandatory 2-night minimum stay meaning: Thursday/Friday, Friday/Saturday, or Saturday/Sunday. Studio Penthouse: Queen Murphy bed in living area. Shower/no bathtub or full bath. Partial kitchen with 2-burner stovetop and no oven. Maximum occupancy 2. **Please read all details below** The Resort maintains a high standard through its maintenance, upgrade, and refurbishment program. As a result the unit characteristics may change from time to time and vary.      When you check into the resort, the front desk will require a $100 security deposit hold against a credit/debit card in case any major damage should occur. The security deposit will be released back to you on the day of departure. ABSOLUTELY NO PETS ALLOWED!  If you have a service animal, you must let us know in writing prior to booking. PARKING: Valet parking is available for $49 per night (subject to change) w

Description: Located downtown in the Waterfront Park District by the Willamette River. Home to the famous Farmers Market, Chinese Garden, Oregon Maritime Museum, Pearl District, and Pioneer Square. Enjoy great coffee shops, bars, restaurants, and shops. This spacious studio sleeps 2 guests in a queen bed. You will have a kitchen, free WiFi, and HDTV. The resort has an owner lounge, fitness center, outdoor terrace w/ fire pit, laundry room and convenience store. As a VIP guest, you may check in at 2 pm. Description: Rare short-term rental in the Pearl District with a secure parking space.  Dog friendly to friendly dogs. This is a ground floor corner unit with a separate entry from the main tower.  It is a loft.  The "bedroom" upstairs is open to the main floor with curtains and blinds.  The full bath is on the second floor.  The main floor has a half bath, sofa bed and the kitchen. Dogs are welcome but at no time are to be left unattended. There is no washer/dryer. We live a couple of miles away and our office is a couple of blocks away. Once upon a time, the Pearl District was a rundown warehouse district.  Now its one of the prime spots in Portland.  Shops, parks, restaurants feature throughout the neighborhood. The east to west streets in the Pearl District are numbered starting from the Willamette River, working west. Starting at West.  Burnside, the streets are alphabetical including many Simpsons characters (Flanders, Glisan to name a few).  The condo is near both the Portland streetcar and

Burnside, the streets are alphabetical including many Simpsons characters (Flanders, Glisan to name a few).  The condo is near both the Portland streetcar and the MAX light rail which runs from the airport.  TriMet buses run throughout the area.

Description: Pearl District boutique stay in a historic building. Recently reimagined décor offers a much-needed refresh. Plus it’s an easy 4-min jaunt from Portland Union Station (if that’s how you roll). Your room charge will be paid prior to your arrival. The remaining balance of taxes (6% City Tax, 5.5% County Tax, 2% Tourism Tax) will be charged upon arrival. A refundable security deposit of $XX will also be collected. Modern interiors are warm and inviting, done up in shades of bold blue and light gray with subtle tone-on-tone patterns. In the heart of the trendy Pearl District with easy streetcar access to downtown, PSU and NW 23rd.  Includes Wi-Fi and underground parking. 3 month minimum rental.
Transit: Ideally located for the urban adventurer, this beautiful home is surrounded by restaurants, coffee shops, shopping, and parks. Located on the streetcar line, this location provides easy access to NW 23rd, downtown, and the eastside.

Access: The entire 3rd floor suite is yours to use, with a few restrictions: -The 2 locked closets in the utility room and the hallway. -The fire escape balcony outside the windows of the main room. -The rooftop of Dante's which is visible from various other windows. These are off-limits, with no exceptions. This is strictly enforced, and we will ask you to leave immediately if ignored. (Using the fire escape for anything other than an emergency exit is illegal, and you - the guest - are 100% responsible for any potential injuries, legal troubles, or fines issued.)

Description: Stylish and spacious convenience for a private, relaxing get-together. Located downtown on the 3rd floor above iconic Portland music venue Dante's, in the heart of Portland's Nightlife District, this beautifully remodeled suite offers the best in luxury and entertainment. This vintage apartment spent the last few months being almost completely renovated into a gorgeous private getaway. It's located downtown above Dante's on Burnside & 3rd, so this is your chance to experience "real" Portland. You'll have a nearly private entrance and stairwell that leads up to the 3rd floor suite, where you'll have the entire suite to yourself - it's the only one on the top floor of a building that nobody lives in! That means you won't have to worry about a noise curfew, getting any noise complaints, or dealing with nosy neighbors.  The suite has its own private WiFi connection, a dedicated Netflix account (which can run on all 5 TV's at once), Xfinity cable TV in the main room, and a Bluetooth/AUX com
House Rules: 1) No more than 10 people allowed in the suite - that is the max capacity. 2) No additional/unregistered guests allowed - anyone staying must be included in the original reservation. 3) No early check-ins and no late check-outs (unless previously discussed and agreed upon with the host at least 3 days prior to reservation). 4) Large front room windows must stay closed at ALL times (unless the fire escape must be used in an emergency). 5) Opened alcoholic beverages being consumed in the rental space cannot leave the suite (this includes the stairwell area). 6) Damages exceeding the deposit will be billed to the guest and reported to Airbnb. 7) No smoking. 8) No pets. 9) No illegal activity. 10) Dispose of your garbage in one of the various trash cans. 11) Please help conserve energy by turning off lights, heaters, AC, TV's, etc. while not using or while away from the suite. Regarding events and parties: we say we don't allow them, but obviously that's kind of a grey area. If you're up f
Interaction: There is a welcome guide/house manual on the coffee table which should provide you with any information you might need. In case you need to get a hold of me more urgently than contacting me through the Airbnb site, it also has my phone number (as well as the owner’s) for any questions, comments, or concerns. Texting is preferred, and feel free to do so anytime, but please keep in mind that we may not always be able to promptly respond. We are on or near the property at various hours most days and/or nights.
Name: Burnside Suites: Private 3rd Floor Apartment
Space: This vintage apartment spent the last few months being almost completely renovated into a gorgeous private getaway. It's located downtown above Dante's on Burnside & 3rd, so this is your chance to experience "real" Portland. You'll have a nearly private entrance and stairwell that leads up to the 3rd floor suite, where you'll have the entire suite to yourself - it's the only one on the top floor of a building that nobody lives in! That means you won't have to worry about a noise curfew, getting any noise complaints, or dealing with nosy neighbors.  The suite has its own private WiFi connection, a dedicated Netflix account (which can run on all 5 TV's at once), Xfinity cable TV in the main room, and a Bluetooth/AUX compatible stereo that also plays vinyl, CD's, and tapes. There are 4 other separate rooms, each with a remote-adjustable queen-sized bed, a wall-mounted TV, a vintage desk, an alarm clock, and more.
Summary: Stylish and spacious convenience for a private, relaxing get-together. Located downtown on the 3rd floor above iconic Portland music venue Dante's, in the heart of Portland's Nightlife District, this beautifully remodeled suite offers the best in luxury and entertainment.
Transit: Within walking distance of all TriMet MAX and bus lines. Motorized scooters and pay-to-ride bicycles are everywhere. Lyft and Radio Cab drivers are also everywhere.

Description: Unparalleled access to downtown Portland is the name of the game—and here you’ll be at the center of it all. This warm, inviting 2-bedroom apartment in a historic home is perfect for a business trip, attending a game at Providence Park, visiting PSU parents/students (campus is just a few blocks away), or weekend getaways in Portland. Grab coffee from the Keurig, then catch the streetcar/MAX downtown. Spend your Portland adventure here, where getting around is a snap! Step on up to this historic, 1910’s building. The original wood work evoke an earlier time, while modern renovations keep things comfortable (the building was updated in 2019). A vintage apartment doesn’t mean a lack of amenities—you’ll enjoy blazing-fast WiFi. You’ll sleep soundly in the serene bedrooms. Snuggle into the one of our queen beds. The simple living space holds a gray couch with a comfortable pull-out bed and a 65 inch flatscreen TV. Large windows throughout the unit let in plenty of light with a great view of
Interaction: I am available as needed!
Name: Quiet peaceful 2BR Apt Walkable Downtown
Space: Step on up to this historic, 1910’s building. The original wood work evoke an earlier time, while modern renovations keep things comfortable (the building was updated in 2019). A vintage apartment doesn’t mean a lack of amenities—you’ll enjoy blazing-fast WiFi. You’ll sleep soundly in the serene bedrooms. Snuggle into the one of our queen beds. The simple living space holds a gray couch with a comfortable pull-out bed and a 65 inch flatscreen TV. Large windows throughout the unit let in plenty of light with a great view of the city. The full bathroom is detached from the bedrooms, so couch-surfers won’t feel out of place. Here you can take a soak in the tub after a long day exploring the City of Roses. The kitchen is small but mighty—there’s an oven and 4-burner gas range, and a full-size fridge. The checkerboard floor is a delightful old-school touch, and there’s room for four at the table. A Keurig with coffee pods ensures you won’t miss out on your caffeine fix in the morning.
Summary: Unparalleled access to downtown Portland is the name of the game—and here you’ll be at the center of it all. This warm, inviting 2-bedroom apartment in a historic home is perfect for a business trip, attending a game at Providence Park, visiting PSU parents/students (campus is just a few blocks away), or weekend getaways in Portland. Grab coffee from the Keurig, then catch the streetcar/MAX downtown. Spend your Portland adventure here, where getting around is a snap!

Description: Three queen beds with high-quality Serta mattresses in a modern luxury two-bedroom apartment. Toiletries, 50" TV, towels, street parking available. Description: Stay on Willamette River in this beautiful, rich and warm contemporary 2 story condo on the top floor! Open kitchen and living room with Cherry hardwood floors, Granite Counters & Stainless Appliances. The condo is Stylishly decorated with travel artwork as well as original paintings created by the owner. It has a unique boutique and tailored feel to it, a lot of love went into this place! Private deck too! Come have a magnificent stay in portland in one of the best locations available! Sliders to a private deck overlooking the river, a community pool, hot tub and BBQ area. New carpet up and loft style bedroom with laundry upstairs. Access to waterfront boardwalk, pool, hot tub, bbq. We live out of town but have a friend who lives in the complex who is very helpful and can assist you with any needs you may have! On the edge of the Pearl, shops & eats. Walk score 87/ Biker's paradise 94!! Deeded covered parking! Grocery corner store located in the complex as well as a pizza/bar joint! H

Transit: There is fast access to amtrak trains/busses or the MAX (light rail) just across the road that leads to an awesome foot bridge that is really cool. You can walk to the love joy area which has a lot of cool architecture, parks and outside artwork. The walk itself is very cool as you can hop on the river at the bottom of the stairs leading up to the condo. There is also a busline that you can catch right outside of the complex

Description: I can accept a 1-night stay for a weekend night if the date is within 14 days. Otherwise, Friday or Saturday nights are a mandatory 2-night minimum stay meaning: Thursday/Friday, Friday/Saturday, or Saturday/Sunday. Studio Penthouse: Queen Murphy bed in living area. Shower/no bathtub or full bath. Partial kitchen with 2-burner stovetop and no oven. Maximum occupancy 2. **Please read all details below** The Resort maintains a high standard through its maintenance, upgrade, and refurbishment program. As a result the unit characteristics may change from time to time and vary.      When you check into the resort, the front desk will require a $100 security deposit hold against a credit/debit card in case any major damage should occur. The security deposit will be released back to you on the day of departure. ABSOLUTELY NO PETS ALLOWED!  If you have a service animal, you must let us know in writing prior to booking. PARKING: Valet parking is available for $49 per night (subject to change) w
Name: Portland Waterfront Park, Studio Penthouse #2
Space: **Please read all details below** The Resort maintains a high standard through its maintenance, upgrade, and refurbishment program. As a result the unit characteristics may change from time to time and vary.      When you check into the resort, the front desk will require a $100 security deposit hold against a credit/debit card in case any major damage should occur. The security deposit will be released back to you on the day of departure. ABSOLUTELY NO PETS ALLOWED!  If you have a service animal, you must let us know in writing prior to booking. PARKING: Valet parking is available for $49 per night (subject to change) with in & out privileges.   There is public parking lot for $25 per night.  There is street metered parking.  Visitors are encouraged to take advantage of Portland’s robust public transportation system, including MAX (Metropolitan Area Express) Light Rail. The nearest MAX station, Oak Street/SW 1st Avenue, is just a short walk from the resort.  Unit Amenities · Ceiling F

Description: This room is inside a 3 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment and is bigger than the king rooms at the Nines hotel as well as hotel sentinel which are our only two 5 star hotels in Portland!! This place may not be suitable for everyone, seniors or older guest may not like the location.  Close to all the nightlife and business.  This place is for travelers who want to be close to everything and not have to make a fuss to commute anywhere!! I am a discreet person.   I do not have neighbors next to my apartment and I prefer it this way.   I’m not someone who tells residents in the building my business or ever have any residents in the building over for tea or anything like this. So I hope and expect my guest to respect this and represent me in this manner.    I prefer not to have residents that I have to live with and see on occasions asking me questions or trying to force friendships or relationships on me.   I pick this apartment because it’s secluded and has no next door neighbors!     I’m disc
House Rules: Kitchen is microwave and refrigerator only no stove top or meal preparation allowed.   Basically can heat up or store left overs from take out thanks :)

However my guest privacy is extremely important to me and I do go above and beyond to make you feel in a sense that you have your own place instead of a private room!

Description: Whether you're a foodie, craft beer fanatic, coffee snob, or lover of the great outdoors, come see what The City of Roses has in store for you at our newly remodeled one-bedroom apartment in central downtown. Situated in a turn-of-the-century building in a quieter part of downtown near PSU and the South Park Blocks, you'll have a comfortable home-away-from-home all to yourselves while in a prime location to discover everything that keeps Portland weird! No matter what time of year you come to visit, the apartment's basement location means you'll be cool in the summer and warm in the winter. And with big windows allowing in plenty of natural light, you likely won't feel like you're in a basement. The historic building (built in 1908) has been well-kept to preserve it's original charm, but with this apartment's brand new remodel in 2016, you'll have beautiful new hardwoods, new appliances, and a clean, minimalist design to make you feel at home. Name: Unique and Charming Basement Apartment Near PSU
Space: No matter what time of year you come to visit, the apartment's basement location means you'll be cool in the summer and warm in the winter. And with big windows allowing in plenty of natural light, you likely won't feel like you're in a basement. The historic building (built in 1908) has been well-kept to preserve it's original charm, but with this apartment's brand new remodel in 2016, you'll have beautiful new hardwoods, new appliances, and a clean, minimalist design to make you feel at home. With a unique, studio-like layout (no door between the bedroom and living room), this is an ideal space for a single traveler or a couple - with a ridiculously comfortable queen-size bed to retreat to after spending the day getting lost in a sea of books at Powell's (the world's largest bookstore). However, the futon in the living room has its own linens to accommodate two more if needed. Description: Get ready to keep Portland weird. This funky 1-bedroom hideaway—just one block from the MAX line—is perfect for a weekend getaway to the City of Roses. It’s found at the intersection of affordability and killer location—need we say more? Privacy and the comforts of home, all in an adorable package! You can walk right up to this ground-level unit. Inside you’ll find trendy decor, a comfortable queen-size bed, and blazing-speed WiFi. The petite kitchen packs a powerful punch, fully stocked with a Keurig and whatever you need to craft a quick meal. If you’ve brought a small group (3 people max!) you can pull the couch into a comfy futon. The bathroom is off the living space, and features a stand-up shower—there’s no time to soak in a tub, when you’re soaking up all Portland has to offer. This basement unit stays cool in the summer and warm in winter (no A/C required). There’s a coin-operated washer and dryer for your convenience, so you can handle whatever your Portland adventure throws y

Description: Curious about what makes Portland so weirdly wonderful? Live like a local and find out for yourself at our newly furnished, one-bedroom apartment in downtown Portland. Comfortably blending modern conveniences with historic charm, the apartment sits in a 100-year-old building near Jeld Wen Field and the South Park Blocks - perfectly situated to sample some of Portland's favorite pastimes, like getting lost at Powell's City of Books and drinking copious amounts of coffee and microbrews. While right in the mix of things, the apartment is in a quieter part of downtown, meaning you'll have the peace and privacy to fully recharge after a long day of hiking or BrewCycling (yes, it's a thing). With an ultra-comfy queen-size bed in the bedroom and a surprisingly comfortable queen-size futon in the family room to sleep four, this is a great place for a couple or small group of friends looking for an affordable home base to take on The Rose City. Though it has just undergone a new renovation, the
Name: Comfy & Cozy Filled Portland Apartment
Space: While right in the mix of things, the apartment is in a quieter part of downtown, meaning you'll have the peace and privacy to fully recharge after a long day of hiking or BrewCycling (yes, it's a thing). With an ultra-comfy queen-size bed in the bedroom and a surprisingly comfortable queen-size futon in the family room to sleep four, this is a great place for a couple or small group of friends looking for an affordable home base to take on The Rose City. Though it has just undergone a new renovation, the apartment's historic roots shine through, with much of the original woodwork still in tact. And with modern amenities like super-fast WiFi, new furniture, and a 50" LED flat-screen cable TV, you'll feel right at home. If you feel like staying in to eat, you'll have a compact kitchen with all the cooking essentials and a convenient grocery store just a few blocks away. Description: Unparalleled access to downtown Portland is the name of the game—and here you’ll be at the center of it all. This warm, inviting 1-bedroom apartment in a historic home is perfect for a business trip, visiting PSU parents/students (campus is just a few blocks away), or weekend getaways in Portland. Grab coffee from the Keurig, then catch the streetcar downtown. Spend your Portland adventure here, where getting around is a snap! Step on up to the private entrance of this historic, 1920’s building. The hardwood floors and classic radiators evoke an earlier time, while modern renovations keep things comfortable (the building was updated in 2017). A vintage apartment doesn’t mean a lack of amenities—you’ll enjoy blazing-fast WiFi and a coin-operated laundry on-site. You’ll sleep soundly in the serene bedroom. Name: Vintage Charmer near Central Downtown/PSU
Space: Step on up to the private entrance of this historic, 1920’s building. The hardwood floors and classic radiators evoke an earlier time, while modern renovations keep things comfortable (the building was updated in 2017). A vintage apartment doesn’t mean a lack of amenities—you’ll enjoy blazing-fast WiFi and a coin-operated laundry on-site. You’ll sleep soundly in the serene bedroom. Snuggle into the queen bed with inviting blue patterned comforter. The simple living space holds a gray couch with a comfortable fold-out bed and a flatscreen TV. Large windows throughout the unit let in plenty of light. The full bathroom is detached from the bedroom, so couch-surfers won’t feel out of place. Name: 2BR Vintage Charmer near Providence Park
Space: Step on up to the private entrance of this historic, 1920’s building. A vintage apartment doesn’t mean a lack of amenities—you’ll enjoy blazing-fast WiFi and a card operated laundry on-site. You’ll sleep soundly in the two serene bedrooms. Snuggle into the comfy queen mattresses. The simple living space holds a black couch with a comfortable fold-out bed and a 65 inch flatscreen TV. Large windows throughout the unit let in plenty of light. The full bathroom is detached from the bedrooms, so couch-surfers won’t feel out of place. Here you can take a soak in the tub after a long day exploring the City of Roses. The kitchen is small but mighty—there’s an oven and 4-burner gas range, and a full-size fridge. The checkerboard floor is a delightful old-school touch, and there’s room for two at the farm-style table (lift up the leaves if you’ve cooked a feast). A Keurig with coffee pods ensures you won’t miss out on your caffeine fix in the morning.

Description: Nestled in Portland's Cultural District, this Georgian condo  features stainless steel appliances, a beautifully furnished livingroom, and plenty of natural light. Washer and dryer are stacked in unit. Comes fully furnished! During your stay, you will be just a quick text away from the host! Great location! Just half a block to PSU, Farmer's Market, Museum, Theaters, Historical Society, and Starbucks. Easy access to public transit and downtown Portland. Near OHSU. Enjoy all of the building's amentities including a courtyard, common room, and fitness room with hot tub. Highly walkable in the heart of downtown Portland. MAX and Bus lines easily available. Uber/Lyft-friendly as well.
House Rules: Quiet hours from 10pm to 7am. Please leave shoes by front door.

Description: Strand glass towers condominium located at Willamette River Waterfront Park.  1 bath, 801 sq. ft. condo located at 1930 SW River Dr Unit W907, Portland, OR 97201 amenities include hardwood, granite, marble and tile finishes; elegant, state-of-the-art kitchens; fireplaces in many units; and generous terraces. Building amenities include concierge service and secured underground parking. The Strand complex will also feature a restaurant owner pays trash and sewer. Tenant responsible for utilities(Electric, Gas), cable, and internet wifi.
House Rules: Quit time after pm ; No Shoe in the house.

Description: This is a very nice 1 Bedroom Penthouse Suite (Sleeps 4) at the  Worldmark Resort perfectly located in the heart of downtown Portland! Excellent location walking distance to everything. Great location near waterfront park, bars, restaurants, nightlife, etc. Eccentric, Exciting and Accessible. You'll find yourself immersed in the heart of downtown in the Historic Waterfront District, with the peaceful Willamette River on one side and a bustling mecca on the other.
